I love the new staff and always sit at the bar with Roxanne for lunch. She's wonderful, remembers my drink and order, she has lots of patience when dealing with needy guest. Sitting at the bar I see a lot and she is a True Gem for this location. The food is fresh and the drinks amazing."

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States

Fhtyiyles2C-0a7saBPyPQ.text: We've been to Sammy's a bunch of times and always have had a good experience. The restaurant is laid out in 3 very separate areas. The gaming partition is completely separate with a separate entrance (only a shared bathroom). On entering the main restaurant, to the left is a more traditional dining area. To the right is an airier, more casual dining area, with some couches and some tables, with lots more light. We've come for HH and had the chicken lettuce cups (excellent!!), baba ghanoush, hummus, and dip sampler. Not disappointed with any of them. The pizza is thin crust. Quite good. This last visit I had the shrimp angel hair pasta. It has roasted mushrooms and artichoke. I asked for light lobster cream sauce - they made it perfectly. And as usual, service was excellent.

9zWmAeYCQWO7wcZX89sW_w.text: This is my favorite restaurant. I enjoy their food every time, always yummy and reasonable prices keep me coming back for more. Try the duck tacos when you're there, awesome! The staff are always friendly and have smiles all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Went to Sammy&#39;s Saturday for the game. They have a game special menu for $25.00 and the portions are for two. The staff are very friendly.

BX6Srn5KSNt-7TCVNo7RYw.text: With the multitude of bars around the Green Valley-Henderson area, we have options. But there is absolutely no place like Sammy's. If you've seen Cheers, the gaming bar is precisely that type of atmosphere. Everyone knows your name, your story, and you know theirs. If you're looking for a place to be a regular, this is the place.   Jamie and Chris are THE people that put all of us regulars together and created a strong sense of community. Jamie works Friday through Monday nights, Chris works Tuesday through Thursday nights. COME. THESE. NIGHTS. I, Jamie and Chris, and all the other regulars will welcome you with open arms. I'm writing this as I am currently bonding with the rest of the crew and Jamie. He is immensely professional, all the while making you feel at home. Having an amazing relationship with guests is key and both of them blend that immaculately with professionalism.  We were raving about the great promotions Sammy's has had in the past, and management informed us that Jamie was actually the one who came up with many of the ones we were raving about! I work in Corporate Marketing for Caesars Entertainment and part of my job is to create promotions to keep our guests coming and generate revenue. My executives and I (who I introduced to Sammy's and love it as well!) agree that we would LOVE to have Jamie on our team, THAT'S how good he is. Chris is just as exceptional, and all of us regulars agree that we would follow both of them anywhere. My parents introduced me to Sammy's 4 years ago around their grand opening (they are as much of regulars as it gets and visit Jamie and Chris at least 3 times a week) and this is where I happily spent my 21st birthday week two years ago with both of them. They're like my big brothers!  Thank you for all the amazing memories you give us each and every visit, J & C. YOU are the True epitome of service at its finest. Cheers to the many years to come!  (Picture with some of the gang plus Jamie attached! We are family!!!)

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Picture with some of the gang plus Jamie attached! We are family!!!

oYyeNw-Drgg7kd7PNG_htQ.text: We just love Sammy's!  Rachel and Alesia treated us just right tonight. They are so friendly and even remember what we usually order every time we come in. And we try to make it a Friday night routine.  AND our son was visiting LV and wanted to come to Sammy's because we have talked so much about it. Garrett was not working but he arranged it so that we could surprise our son and his girlfriend by paying for their meal by calling in our credit card. And he wasn't even working that night!  This place is our "Cheers"!

bjLy7Av66EvFaOqypZ5Ueg.text: 2nd time here in the last month. The food has nice flavors but the pizzas are a little light on toppings. I ordered a Hawaiian, it only had 1 piece of ham & 2 pieces of pineapple per slice that is not much for a $13 pie. The service is also quite lacking

--eRygtJMwoSILBIMbGhaw.text: Order came out wrong. Food fair. Seats at table uncomfortable. Noise level made conversation difficult.

GONvAk_1Sgt6THSheI0sKw.text: I'm urging people to avoid this place at all costs. My daughters and I ordered a pizza. It was terrible. A frozen pizza from Smith's would have been better. The service was as bad as the food. The server seemed to go out of her way to avoid us. Then she overcharged us & the manager had to make corrections to the bill. There are many good restaurants in the Henderson area.  This isn't one of them.

J_utx-Ac9RzrSQOxDg-RDw.text: The food and service were good. Love the atmosphere! The outside sign has you thinking this is just like a bar food type of place with gaming but when you walk in you will be pleasantly surprised with the decor and service. Very nice menu options, a little pricey for lunch though.

GSNWes8yCQ0LOafRBfVVVA.text: The half priced apps at happy hour are the best.3pm-6pm. Chicken skewers with Thai peanut sauce-awesome. Duck tacos-awesome. Pot stickers rock. Pizza rocks. This place has always been a favorite and its close by. Staff us nice and always use upbeat. I would strongly recommend.

ilDjlWr8YP0LRuiomnK3kw.text: I was never a fan of Sammy's but I will make an exception for this Green Valley location! I love this location!! The 1st time I gave it and tried this place I was hooked! I went back three days in a row!! Lol Great ambiance, yummy food (mini sliders with gorgonzola cheese, pork dumplings, fries with sauce, shrimp & garlic pizza, & fried donuts are my favorites), & their spicy bloody mary's are delicious!! :-P Go check it out, especially during happy hour!! ;)

0kH15KcuwcjfSUwUrXYb6g.text: Went basic today. Its a cold wet day so I had the tomato basil soup and a caesar. Both were okay hard to mess up soup and salad. Waitress was very funny.

DeZ_0pY3yNYv7uKEDtIYqA.text: Well came in today with my girlfriend for the first time had their New York pizza with their own ingredients with chicken wings very good plate on both would recommend their pizza and chicken wings to anybody we will return.

NWmj2f4nmdIAfD8tTTNxZQ.text: To be fair, this was our second time dining at the upgraded version of Sammy's on Green Valley Parkway and we will NOT BE RETURNING.  The breakfasts consist of the same Sysco-type food that every other restaurant in Henderson (and Vegas for that matter)  have to offer.  The same frozen potatoes with peppers, small eggs from GMO fed farms (organic cage-free doesn't mean gmo free) and grossly processed meat.  So save a few bucks and just dine at the Grand Cafe up the street for the same low quality.  What ever you do, don't order your eggs scrambled - it's nasty.   Not sure what mix or cream they used, but it was like eating yellow creamy foam.  Never again.  I will drive the extra miles just to get the best breakfast on earth at EAT downtown.  For a place that boasts "gluten-free" options, I was stunned that they didn't even offer gluten free bread for breakfast.  Their juice drinks at $4+ a clip aren't even fresh - rather they are poured from a bottle and/or the equivalent to drinking a Coke.    Cheap ingredients and originality is very low.  The pizzas could have been frozen for all I knew.  Bland and no flavor.   If you like matzo crackers, then the artisan pizzas are for you.  The salads were wilted and over poured with dressing.  During BOTH visits, the staff refused to give me box for our pizza!  They offered to "box" it, yet BOTH times they ruined two left over pizzas  by wrapping them securely  in aluminum foil!   Who does this?   Do they think  the toppings won't stick to the foil?  Or maybe that people with a nice car don't want food leaking???  When I asked for a "box", I was told, "we don't give out boxes".  Mind you, they give boxes for take out, but if you buy two of the most expensive pizzas and only eat half, you get foil.  I told her that I would pay for a box and so the waitress returned with a plastic container that was clearly too small for the pizza and said "will this do"? Then she walked away in a huff.   The two California investors for this restaurant standing by did nothing.  It is my hope that the CA investors who are constantly on the floor and yet strangely never  interact with patrons, will bring in a few experienced servers from California to demonstrate to Las Vegas waitstaff how the job should be done.  This "i will probably only ever serve you once" mentality is best left for Las Vegas Blvd.

h6f09eQGlL7DRe68mtOY9Q.text: Great food, lots of variety, great health conscious choices, vegan and gluten free options. Friendly staff and management coupled in a beautiful location. Also,  full menu in 24 hour gaming bar and 2 happy hours all week long, 3-6 & 10 -4. Half priced tapas all the way.  Mm mm duck tacos.

eHQbYHvEpnYPZPfwostQHA.text: Really cool place. I went in right before brunch ended and I ordered the happy hour brunch breakfast tacos. These were delicious! Also tried the crispy fries which were equally as yummy. I will definitely be back for more brunch specials. Service was also on point.

21jNxk2uRn_ktJHZVxJgEA.text: Ask for Zack!  He takes care if business and makes you feel at home without kissing your ass.  Happy hour here is a must.  Half off appetizers, cheap drinks.  I'm coming back!

HU2CIIO-RoLElLdf6QOKyw.text: Worst service ever...............and I have to say I have been to many, many, many establishments in my long life............Was seated in an area with only one other table of occupants.............they had GREAT service............we were ignored.........food was served to another table........no followup........manager brought bill, but made absolutely no comment...........will not EVER try again...........even tho the meal was Fabulous.............too many GREAT servers in this valley...........will take our business elsewhere..........Me thinks not is SO VERY CORRECT!  additional note: mother with 2 children were seated right before we got our bill..........NO ONE Paid any attention to them either.............and the restaraunt was barely busy..............must be trying for the going out of business thing!

Tsh0n4qHPvZWHY0kn8wgXQ.text: We decided to go here one day after work because we had seen it pervious day and wanted to try it. Boy am i glad we stopped in and tried them. We got the asparagus scramble, loved it. It's a new twist and some everyday, i couldn't get enough. For being not a huge fan of asparagus i couldn't get enough. But thats not the best part. Their french toast with filling and orange was amazing. Ill definitely be going back for it. The manager, and waiter were very kind. Thank you for making a long day end amazing. We'll be back soon..

Kk5cwsjWaytSytxV_vFJdQ.text: This place is great! They have best margarita pizza I've ever had. The prices are too high and they have a different atmosphere from most restaurants. I would recommend them for groups as well. Happy hour stops at 6 for cheaper food prices so don't come at 7 like I did.

BwydesP2Ohb7rMPKpUoQGA.text: I am enjoying some apps and beer here on happy hour. Lobster Mac&Cheese so good. Good atmosphere friendly staff, Marcus our bartender making drink after drink with a Xmas party here yep he's doing a great job.

uH7x8aDcL97wYxgAzJcSLQ.text: Hey Sammy's, don't put a coupon on the LVRJ if you're going to find every loophole not to honor it.    Pros:  Fabulous decor and location.  Windows open, gorgeous!  Decent burgers.  Decent service (until the coupon issue arose). Cons:  Coconut shrimp was below average.  Usually when I have a skewer I can "fork it off the skewer" and enjoy it.  This was so overcooked, everything was cooked/glued on to the skewer.  Very tough on the outside, didn't even resemble shrimp.

he5N9adz04O2nnQvAzF_sQ.text: Love this place.  Amazing food....great ambience....wicked good white sangria.

n0_eowMCmnxQgKQ0q2Sb5w.text: If you're gluten free, the menu is ripe with options. The service has been wonderful. Timely and attentive. They, also, accept reservations. The meals are on average $12 for dinner. I will be back.

I85vR2BaWwjI6kU4ZeDM0g.text: The only reason this is not a 1-star review is because the food was actually good. The service, however, was terrible. We had a reservation for our large group of 12 but still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. The manager was rude and told us that a reservation was not a guarantee for seating. After we were finally seated, it took over an hour for our food to arrive. It's unfortunate that something as easy to provide as service was so blatantly ignored and that customers were treated as a burden. Get it together or you won't survive the Vegas local's service expectations.

o6DGKlvW-CR0Nm-dMSbVlw.text: I came in for dinner and it was awesome!  The two lovely bartenders were attentive and very friendly. Enjoyed myself every much. Food is on point. For sure a place to go! Thank you Rachel and Alesia

3EegwZ0EuKO_W5XGuw5Zag.text: The waitress was very nice,  but the food wasn't.  The chicken salad was wilted and frozen. It looked odd when it arrived, but the first bit said it all. I'm not sure what to say about the rest. We hadn't been here in a while. Prior to today we always enjoyed it. Now I'm suspicious of the rest of the food. ...like, what other shorts cuts were taken.

dIV6ZTx4DcawCH2cidQU4A.text: We stopped in at lunch to try the $10 power lunch special.  Arrived about 11:45am, and we were seated right away. Sammy's is spacious, lots of tables, a large bar and it looked like banquet type rooms off the the side.  Our server was amazing. Friendly, fast and accurate, exactly what you need at lunch time if your on a time limit.  For my $10, I got a personal Pizza and a Greek salad. Both were great tasting, and it was plenty of food for the price.  We will be back again.

It was my only off-strip dining the last time I was in Vegas, and I just ordered a bunch of shareables (sorry...English spelling): ahi pokes, edamame, curried cauliflower, mahi mahi tacos, baba ganoush, and so on. It was good. The service was very attentive. It's in a business park and isn't the kind of place I would usually go, but I was meeting a group and for that it was perfect.

6bfOxhgJ7NL6zccjt-DEMQ.text: This restaurant is a great staple in our family's favorite places to dine. Friendly staff, quick service, and consistently good food. Variety of options on the kids menu and delicious gluten free crust for those who want/new that option. My husband's favorite topping is their Italian sausage.

awrZzXkc4AlGBAoAR70GYQ.text: This is my closest neighborhood poker bar and I'm giving it another try.  My latest visit was at the bar in the gaming area and I had the shrimp/crab dip & the red quinoa salad (from the regular menu). I was pleased that the bartender gave me both the happy hour menu and the regular menu WITHOUT MY HAVING TO ASK for the happy hour menu! Kudos. I was impressed with how cozy the bar area is. The white lights around the bar really make the place comfy. The bar chairs, not so much.  Back to the food- the shrimp/crab dip was disappointing. If you're gonna feature crab, I better be able to taste it! Not so much here. It was served hot and with plenty of flatbread but the flavor just wasn't there. The salad was excellent and very fresh. Loved the beets & avacado,  Would have again for sure and maybe try some tapas from the happy hour menu next time. They have gaming promos such as earn 250 points on Mondays get $20 play next visit.

mRXIQGGSURxJZu8yz7PWgw.text: Love coming here! The food, location, atmosphere, drinks, and servers are all great. Only complaint is, whenever I'm there, I notice how much the  manager lacks people/customer service skills.

MJ9-zhyVywsoDOEDQKlp7g.text: My wife and I are regulars at Sammy's, we love the place. Great food and a fabulous bar. Garret is fantastic my favorite bar tender. A great place for an after work drink and meal. Give them a try you'll be glad you did. Roy H.

vpB5i2hljU74mBVglhz3Aw.text: I like this place. It's very cozy and it feels good to be there. During warmer times of the year it looks like they open up all the sliding glass windows. Seems like it would create a really cool indoor/outdoor vibe. Would be a lovely spot for Sunday brunch. (AHEM: bottomless mimosas)  Service was great. Food came out relatively quickly (not TOO quickly, that freaks me out), water glasses were never empty, and the server gave great recommendations and was very friendly.   Food was okay. Nothing, out of this world amazing, but still tasty. The menu is very broad, one of those we have a little of everything places. Maybe spreading themselves a little thinly and thats why nothing is absolutely stunning. However I would come back here. Good place to go when you have a large group of picky and/or not adventurous people.

EKDWJkL5WWrNQ3NOhF2TcQ.text: Our group comes here every month for about six months and Julia always waits on us. She remembers our drinks and orders. We get great service and we love the privacy of the back room. Great food and great service, you can't beat it!

3LCUOxfxMdR1Ef0QKmE8tw.text: Absolutely amazing food! The chicken tequila fettuccine and Brussels sprouts keep me coming back time after time. The managers Paras and Jon are always welcoming. Barbara is such a great server and makes the experience that much better! And Garrett's cocktails... the perfect pair to the meal!

suNtzNQc_ubxDHxvlZOOaQ.text: Weren't sure what to expect but the interior was nicer than we had anticipated. My husband and I are currently on a keto diet (zero carbs) and the kind waitress accommodated easily.   Tuna poke to start without wontons it was delicious.   My husband had the Greek salad and she warned the dressing may have a pinch of sugar so we switched it out.   I had the wagyu burger with a lettuce bun. Wasn't asked how I wanted it cooked but it was delicious.   Overall our waitress was extremely attentive and friendly. It was  very busy when we arrived but slowed down a bit near the end. We would come back.

R-rDbbO4UZkUaScfruyR7g.text: just went again and it was awesome! Jamie Mandy Leo Ashley are just so super friendly! thank you for an awesome new year hope everyone is safe and happy.

6SveuBoScOErPLjXn7NxHw.text: Returned a few months ago for a birthday.  Wonderful pear pizza. Good service even though the they were training a newbie server.  The Old Fashion drink was close to expected. The comp birthday treat was really good. The ice cream came in a wine glass dripping in caramel and chocolate sauce. Very unique since the sauce held the glass to the serving plate as well as lined the inside of the glass and was layered over the ice cream.  Yes indeed, will return.  I saw some recent one and two star reviews concerning poor service. Hopefully those situations are major flukes otherwise I'd go somewhere else too.

BbBMnK3HAh3mhBjTvINMUw.text: I have been going to this restaurant since it opened and always had good food and service. Last Monday I visited again and had the BEST experience yet. The bartender was happy and smiling, but the waitress (Mandy) was exceptional. I worked in the service industry for over forty years and she is among the best I have encountered. You have something special in this young lady.

zhk8yGVJ41fABEIj1Yzhbg.text: Yummy food, discounts at happy hour. plenty of parking, wide variety on menu. Lovely green garden is just outside and large sliding doors give the place an open feel. Very satisfied and will return before long.

4FhckAMSrMVFcPmZHC4trA.text: Ooh this place in the Green Valley hood is open 24/7! That was the first thing I noticed when I read the 411 about the new Sammy's restaurant. Because when I have 3am cravings for duck tacos or I want a dessert for breakast(which is the very first thing I did on my official visit here yelp.com/biz_photos/samm...) I know very well where to go now! Yes I have dined here 4 times already! Had fun trying out the Brie French toast during the mock breakfast. Had a blast when they hosted the Yelp Elite Event ( yelp.com/biz/elite-event... ) and been back twice now since they officially opened. It's safe to say I'm a fan. The standouts for me are their tapas and dessert offerings. The tapas menu is pretty unique and has an international flair. There's Asian and Mediterranean cuisine thrown in as well...or should I say fused together..IE their Duck Tacos! Mini taco shells filled with shredded duck,creamy feta cheese and cilantro. They surprisingly pulled off the combo of ingredients. The Hot Rock is another tapas dish and must try. The beef is presented to you raw marinated in ponzu sauce. You have to grill it yourself on a super HOT rock that is on top salt rock crystals which keeps the rock heated. I only wish they would give you a little more slices of beef for the amount you pay for this dish. For desserts, the Sticky Toffee Pudding is wicked good! Sweet moist cake served over a warm toffee sauce that eventually soaks thru. It's paired with a scoop of vanilla ice cream to balance the sweet stuff. Yeah those evil sweets, so best have dessert in the morning so you have all day to burn those calories off! That doesn't help though I was back later for dinner and shared the Messy Sundae with Mr. B. Caramel and Chocolate sauce, walnuts, whip cream all over the place ( yelp.com/biz_photos/samm...) ..need I say more? I also appreciate the focus is on healthy, fresh and organic, like the eggs for the omelet I had were cage free. Yummy Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten free dishes are also served. Adding their Baba Ghanoush to my #Meatless Monday rotation. Atmosphere ..love it! Casual cool and inviting. The livingroom-like dining area on the right side is the place to be! Its another huge factor that plays into this place for being one of the designated neighborhood places to dine. Its open and airy, natural lighting during the day. Love the wicker furnishings it didn't feel cramped at all, the floor to ceiling glass were actually doors that slide open and voila!! It converts to a patio! When its not windy they have it opened up. I'm all about dining al fresco! The small negatives - Breakfast was just okay. I did like what I had though. I think the price point for what you get is just a tad much. I'm guessing maybe because the demographic makeup of this area they mainly cater to can afford it. This place for sure is not your "I come here to-get-my-daily -breakfast-burrito- place. Oh and steak and fries $25? That's a bit much too. Other than that, there's enough dishes well worth it. Service has been great! They are well staffed in all the areas. There was a little wait time to be seated but it was crowded at the entrance. NOTE: They do take reservations and the manager I talked to also said OpenTable will be implemented soon. So I highly advise you make reservations especially for dinner time hours. Well those are the deets! I'm sure Ill have more foodporn pix pop up soon enough since you'll find me here often! Welcome to the neighborhood Sammys!

2d2H6-Gxl_pWMn359gQEZg.text: What can I say about Sammy's that hasn't already been said?   The food is terrific! It's always such a treat to see a whole wheat crust pizza option. The salad portions are huge. Seriously, huge. My only wish for them is that there'd be a smaller/cheaper salad option that I could add on to my meal.   I just love the ambience of this restaurant. It's modern but comfortable. Little to no area to hang out, though, while you wait to be seated... That awkward moment when you're standing half inside/half outside unable to close the door as you wait to be greeted by the hostess.   The service was incredible. They accidentally made my pizza with a regular crust instead of the wheat that I'd ordered. They quickly brought me the correct pizza despite saying I'd just stick with the wrong one and took it off the bill to make up for my "troubles". That is seriously the way to retain loyal customers! Kudos, Sammy's.   Can't wait to go back and try some of the tapas from the half off menu at happy hour!

cszdtacaGNHmpkTTdROU7g.text: Went to Sammy's yesterday to celebrate a special birthday but ended up leaving with the worst experience.  The birthday girl wanted to do bottomless mimosas so we decided to check out Sammys.  A group of 12 (included 2 kids) arrived at the restaurant. The restaurant was almost empty and when we told them how many they asked if we had a reservation. Once we said no, you could tell they were pissed by their tone and posture (keep in mind the restaurant was almost empty)  Once seated we waited 15 minutes without menus or somebody to take our drink orders. After ordering and eating, the server (bartender) brought over the check. We ask him if he could separate the check as most restaurants will do it for you and if they don't they will tell you before you order that they are unable to  After we asked he said that we could not break for parties of 12 or more but could use different payments.( this is something he should of told us when we ordered) The multiple payments were fine and we provided him a couple of cards and told him which food to bill on each card. He then responded and said we need to tell them how our meals cost ( never have I been somewhere where they made the customer add up their meals) He then walked away and gave the receipt to someone else  A woman came to our table (assuming she was a manager who knows) and just said we can't break up the check. There was no introduction of who she was or or apologized for the inconvenience. She had no customer service nor portray herself as a manager.   Instead of leaving the restaurant happy and enjoying a celebration, everybody was irritated with the service that this restaurant provided. Next time we will definitely hit somewhere else

WQNyG3WXsPH3pqilzDQMYA.text: Dropped in here (aka "Sammy's Woodfired Pizza & Grill") when I was struck with an Italio-carb craving ... and remembered an acquaintance has given this venue the thumbs-up.  This restaurant venue is nicely appointed, far more so that I would have expected out of knowing this is a 24/7 VP bar at its core. Truth be told, I never even discovered the gaming area! Continuous floor-to-ceiling windows run three sides of the large, main dining space. I arrived around 6pm on a weekday and the entire space was packed solid. Including a ten-top in the back corner.   Yes, the menu is mostly about the 'za, but there some pasta plates and sandwiches and such. Many of the items are twisted, such as kung-pao calamari, making for a very interesting treat to the palate. I went with grilled Brussels sprouts (w balsamic & nuts) appy at $9.00, then a 14" sausage & onion pizza at $13.75, washed down with an iced tea at $3.25.     The Brussels sprouts were very tasty. OK, YOU don't like Brussels sprouts, but I love them. Especially in this grilled format that's turned up on a number of menus in recent years. A tasty alternative to fronting with a traditional salad, also at $9.00. The pizza was fine, nothing in the range of "I gotta message all my BFFs and tell 'em right now," but tasty. My mistake here was to not step into this venue's twisted world and try something like their Pad Thai pizza.   Then I lucked into a Yelp check-in for a free desert they call a Messy Sundae. I recommend it. And I do NOT recommend it.   OK, it's really a traditional sundae, you know, vanilla ice cream, choco syrup, some nuts, whipped cream, a Maraschino on top. But this place got really creative and turned it into one stupendous presentation. It's served in a wine glass that's been sitting in the freezer ... and that is set upon a small dinner plate. Instead of putting the choco syrup into the glass, on top of the ice cream, they run it (and the nuts) down the sides of the frozen glass until the plate is puddled in it. Then you can dip your ice cream into the puddle. Then a glorious tall cone of whipped cream protrudes from the glass. I am sure there's pictures of it here; check 'em out. That's why I recommend it.   Here's why I DON'T recommend it. It is absolutely impossible to eat it neatly. Impossible. I bibbed my lap with an extra napkin ... and still, as I write this, my khakis are soaking in detergent in my washing machine, hoping to get all the choco droplets out of them. These folks WANT it to be messy, that's plain enough, because the give you a long and teeny-weeny spoon to try to eat it with. So no way your choco-spoon ain't gonna runneth over with every mouthful. And you've got to dig deep in that unsteady wine glass to get your ice cream out. And you'll probably be trying to scrape the nuts and choco off the sides of that glass as well. Grab the glass to steady it ... wah-wah, the glass is coated with syrup. It LOOKS awesome, but you'll earn a gold medal trying to eat it like an adult. I didn't take home the gold ... and once was enough for me. Though my shot at glory was free, you'll pay a $10 entry fee to compete.   My recommended play here is to come in between 3pm & 6pm, when all the apps are half-off. There were at least twenty of them on the menu. Everything from the aforementioned calamari and the Brussels sprouts ... to meatballs, poke, tacos, potstickers, pork dumplings et. al. At half-off, most of them can be snagged at $4.50 to $6.00 each. Four of them would easily make a quite filling four-way-twisted light dinner for two. A much better alternative than racking up a $50 tab in exchange for two personal-sized pizzas fronted by a teaser or two plus beverages.  There's several branches of Sammy's scattered about town, including one inside McCarran. Just more evidence Sammy's is a solid choice.  This unit is just off 215 at Green Valley, at the GV & Pebble intersection, across the street from the strip mall that houses a Smith's and Bank of America & Wells Fargo outparcels.

wAOWo_Cb15ekd1rrnaBCdg.text: I used to be a fan of Sammy's for years but as time as passed my tastes buds have matured. When I heard a new location opened closer to home, i decided to check them out.   The place is huge and elegant, especially the bar area its perfect for happy hour. La Dou's Barbecue Chicken pizza is fantastic, nice balance of sweet and savory. I also got the Spicy Italian Sausage, it was okay I thought lacked flavor.  Overall it was an okay experience, hasn't changed much since the last time i went. I'm glad it's still around it brings back good memories.

pTcH8Oa87Gj-mzrlPRkc8Q.text: Gotta say, I didn't know what to expect with this being tucked away in a business park but it was probably the best meal we had in Vegas all week (Giada's was pretty good too).   Decor and Vibe  This was a very cool "mature" version of Sammy's which I am used to living in California. They had these great open windows that actually slide open to open up to the outside so the entire restaurant became almost a patio. Beautiful decor, with very cool fire pits for groups.   Food  Loved how many healthy options were on the menu. My wife is super picky and gluten free. We shared a Mediterranean plate, a balsamic chicken salad and Mahi Tacos.. all around deliciousness.    Service   The server was very helpful and gave us great information for their $10 lunch special that we couldn't do because we were there later than the timeframe, but it sounded great.  Parting Thoughts  This is a great spot to bring a business meeting, an event, a date.. definitely sophisticated and affordable. Wish they had one of these in San Diego!

I frequent this location at minimum once a week and I have never received such poor service as I did today. The lack of consideration I received while dining with my black friends was remenisant of Jim Crowe laws. I attempted to address a major concern to the manager opening the huge patio doors in front of my table to accommodate another guest when the   temperature outside was 62 and our party was literally freezing, only to be addressed in such a condescending manner by the assistant manager TAMERA. Px1TYUORAqAyNqTSAJdtew.text: Came in on a Saturday for lunch, the place was packed! what a beautiful setting, I felt like I was back in California. Very open and windows everywhere! Sat at the bar, with the bartender Mary. Wow what a sweetie. She was truly on her game.  My bf and I split a few apps. We had the hummus and duck tacos. Mary even had the chef prepare slices of the gluten free crust so I would have something other then veggies to dip. And the duck tacos, I could eat these everyday they are so good. Grilled duck, with cilantro, tomatoes, fetta and some type of cilantro sauce. Theyre amazing. We will def be coming back here soon.

tzE_W4xQfJE8MHN9t-kf7Q.text: TWO STARS is all you get. Reason being I am glad this location was not taken over by a pawn shop, happy ending spa or a needle exchange and also because the food is decent. I repeat. The food is decent.   My big beef with this restaurant is the service. When I say service I mean the Management.   I have been to Sammy's on three separate occasions. First time with a fellow Yelper for brunch and I had the breakfast tacos which were good. Not great, but good. Service was on point.  Second visit was at lunch time on a Sunday with my mother. It took our waitress 25 minutes to get us our drinks. I realize how long it takes to get water and how difficult it is. What was even more annoying than our waitress was the fact that they let the patrons who were sitting at the nice bar in the center of the restaurant scream at the TV during the football game. They were tossing back $10 bottomless Mimosas and obnoxiously reacting to every play and startling all of the dining customers who most of them appeared to have just come from church. Not cool especially because this restaurant has a side sports bar where they should have been directed to. Not cool especially because the Managers did nothing at all about it. The Managers stood by the bar and watched the game the entire time, too! Not my idea for a relaxing Sunday brunch. If I wanted this ruckus I would have gone to the sports book!  Third visit I really disliked a pasta dish I was sharing. Took one bite and no more. I mentioned it to the waitress and was still charged for it. Way to keep it classy, Sammy's.   NOT ONCE IN ANY OF MY VISITS DID THE MANAGERS TOUCH ANY TABLES TO SEE IF THE GUESTS WERE HAPPY WITH THEIR FOOD AND SERVICE.  Lastly, I did not want to write this review.It's my favorite time of year when I pretty much love everyone and everything.  I shared my frustration with their website directly. But, when 2 MONTHS later I did not receive anything more than a generated email response from the Sammy's website I knew I had to let the Yelp family know. I will not be playing it again, Sam I am.

QQgXuf_wyPyqzKaXP_LxSg.text: We went there Saturday night. It was great. We ordered greek salad, the pasta with chicken and a creamy sauce, which was very flavorful, and wine. It was a price fixed dinner. The pudding dessert was ok, nothing special.  The service was very professional and prompt. also, the rest room was being restocked when I visited, which shows attention to detail that I appreciated.

FDffQZkA6evtdmgQwpdRMQ.text: Middle of the week lunch with a friend and decided on Sammy's. Upon arrival, the restaurant was not busy for the day of the week. After a few minutes of socializing, we were waiting on our server, who looked as if she was consumed with more than she can handle. It took a little longer to get her attention and get in our food to meet the time requirement for the lunch menu special. My friend and I ordered a soup and each a subsequent dish. We both expected the soup to be out as our first course but instead, everything was brought out together. The server was very nice and polite but we felt that the service was a bit slow. The food was good and the atmosphere is awesome, the service, however can be little more refined.

PFTfVGmVcsPnGTstVaXjOQ.text: This place always has great food. Never fails. From bottomless mimosas to a casual beer and pizza night, this place has a friendly neighborhood vibe. There may be some wait staff that have a short attitude; let's be honest, it isn't easy serving in this town. Markus, the Monday through Friday bartender is truly genuine and probably helps makes the "regulars". He knows his drinks. It would be nice to see the menu change with the season. One last thought... Beware of the shishito peppers; although mild at times (still cooked to perfection) you may get a plate of hot ones! Luckily the amazing peanut based dipping sauce is close at hand to help relieve the mouth. On a side note, the sauce served with the shishito peppers is amazing for dipping their calamari, and pretty much any other vegetable.

mxoqOiguwXH3SkkZQqqOsQ.text: It's been years since I've been to Sammy's and Joel had never been so when he won a $25 gift certificate we decided to check it out for lunch.   I enjoyed the atmosphere. It was very calming with all the light woods and fake water tanks. Our server was very prompt and brought us our drinks. I really loved the menu. I'd go back just for the tapas. They all sounded very yummy. We picked the Duck tacos to start with and I got the Shrimp pasta and Joel got the New York style pizza. Wow! The Duck tacos! Yuuuuummmmy! I could have just eaten like 20 of these little bite size tacos. You do get 6 tacos ( I was forced to share with Joel. Hehe) they are filled with grilled duck, a creamy avocado and cilantro sour cream, queso fresco, and bits of tomato and fresh cilantro. Really! What a treat that was. My Shrimp pasta was also so yummy! (I love that I had the choice of whole wheat pasta.) My dish contained huge shrimp, zucchini, artichoke hearts, mushrooms, and it was all mixed with a light and creamy lobster sauce. I was in heaven! The $19 it cost was so totally worth every penny! Joel's pizza had mushrooms, pepperoni, salami, and Italian sausage with a red sauce. The sauce was full of flavor and Joel loved all the meat that was on it.   Other then our waitress not noticing the gift certificate and charging our card full price it was a great experience. ( she felt really bad that she messed up) The decor is great, the atmosphere relaxing and the food was on point. It is a bit pricey, but with the level of food they have it's justified. Can't wait to go back and try more of their tapas.

qWb6qegTbNbsVkbeli2xUQ.text: Well anything that replaces an Applebee's is already a plus in my book. I like Sammy's Pizza, it's usually convenient when I meeting my friends who live across town or meeting friends with kids, as I find them very kid friendly. I've visited the Arroyo Crossing & the W. Sahara location multiple times and it is never a disappointment. I love their Pear & Gorgonzola pizza along with the others, BBQ, Margarita. My favorite app is the Duck Tacos (not to be confused with the duck quesadilla, not a fan). And who doesn't love the Messy Sundae?   This location is great, huge open floor plan, bar right in the middle, but my favorite thing about this location is the wall facing Green Valley Pkwy opens up and exposes the entire restaurant to fresh air. I love it! This is definitely a great addition to the GV area. Can't wait to come and try brunch. This place is pretty decent when it comes to chain restaurants.

vEw4r9pIWV-7vmsaSW6rXA.text: Horrible experience with the staff! I work in this area and I refuse to come back here. There are other reataurants within the vicinity with far better food quality AND excellent staff.

WVg8GOss80fUdrwuuHEcZw.text: Went here on Wednesday and was happy to find out they have wine Wednesdays. Half off all bottles! I was in the mood for some small plate options and this had some interesting things on the menu. My husband and I started with three which would have been enough but decide to squeeze in one more. Duck Tacos-Great sauce but meat could have had more flavor.  Meditarnian dipping plate-Terrific! Fresh pitas, great hummus and the cheese and sesame so very good.  Pork dumplings - decent with a little crunch which was nice.  Coconut shrimp with orange/horshradish dipping sauce-Amazing! The best thing we had. They should bottle that sauce.  Over all the atmosphere was very nice with comfortable seating, dim lights. Our server was terrific (I think her name was Adriana?). Service was quick, attentive and our wine was very good.  The only reasons it didn't get 5 stars was: A) The host was slow greeting us at the door. It would have been nice if the servers or bartenders at least greeted us as they past and let us know someone was coming soon. B) It was just a little pricey for the food. Not too bad, just a little over what it should be I think.  We will be back on Wednesdays for sure!

Xvogo7hzCYno6Tkwc6bLpQ.text: We went for an event the other night and WOW best food in town, seriously!!! They serve 4 dif salads all FABULOUS, 4 did piazzas 'to die for' & 4 dif pastas all Fantastic, my fav was angle hair pasta with Tomatoe sauce, I'm going back SOON!! Y'all should go TODAY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Here&#39;s the desert!!! Everything we had here was Great!!!!

BnBtHhXHZqY-TG5Idbolqg.text: I absolutely love the location and vibe of this place. I sat at the bar on the restaurant side and I believe our bar tender was Caitlin. She was very personable and tentative. We had some of the happy hour appetizers, which were delicious. I will definitely be going back.

CBf_Cs4I8X-w-zIGsqMKcw.text: Very good option In Henderson!! Nice place, good food. Not expensive.  Lot of choices on menu for different tastes.

s5Ti3iWrcoXyrK042rpKnQ.text: Gave it a whirl.  Really like the indoor yet outdoor feeling of the "patio" dining area. I love their patio dining atmosphere... open, airy and just all around fun... like being in someone's solarium.  The groupings of tables and "booths" which are overstuffed chairs/couches is really nice.  I'm thinking this would be a nice place for happy hour... not dark and closed in like some places... this is light and open.    Their salads are big enough to share. Their Mediterranean appetizer trio is awesome... love it!   The chicken lettuce wraps are filling if you happen to get them as an entree like I did. Well... ok... so I was full after eating most of the appetizer and then my lettuce wraps.  Next time.... if I go with my mom again... we'll order 1 salad and 1 Med appetizer and that will do us just fine.  Note... don't order a Bellini... they don't make it with peach puree or peach juice... it just came out as sparkling wine.  This was a miss.

GGX9lhis84_unJf6ch4wKw.text: chicken salad was dry like the desert. service very slow. unhappy hour is what they should call their happy hour. first time eating here, last time eating here.

Qfbo-Ykf6jY50RYn8DIOgw.text: Quick look: quality and affordable comfort food. Specialty is gourmet wood oven pizzas and massive salads. Very comfortable, open air room - if you can figure out how to get to the front door!   In depth review: very familiar with this Vegas Valley chain and decided to try it out on a Monday night. After a few minutes of navigation through the adjacent business park trying to figure out how to find Sammy's parking lot and entrance, we walked in and were surprised at how busy it was. Bar had a good crowd for MNF. After waiting a couple minutes we were seated at a large table / booth towards the front (facing Green Valley Parkway). It was a chilly Monday night and they did have one of the sliding glass walls open. I enjoyed the fresh air but my lady was cold (as usual). So bring a sweater or jacket if you go in Fall / Winter season at night.   Service was prompt. Our waiter was still trying to master the little touch screen they use to take orders. He suggested a flatbread appetizer that comes with three different Hummus style dipping sauces. So we ordered that along with a margarita pizza and a grilled shrimp salad. Explained to him that we wanted the pizza and the salad brought out together as our entrees and that we would split them. So we wait about 25 minutes (too long) and finally our flat bread and dip came out to munch on as an appetizer. As soon as I reach for it another runner arrives with our entrees in hand. Was not too pleased and explained that we just got our appetizer and please take the entrees back. For some reason many quality places in Vegas have this issue with timing and seem to want to turn tables as fast as they can?!  Waiter comes back and apologizes. Blames it on the kitchen (obviously). Either way, we enjoy the appetizer and the entrees come out later. They were great. The salad was massive and could easily feed 2 - 3 people. The pizza was cooked perfect and blew similar style at a CPK or Settebello out of the water!   We were too full for desert but I could see the tables around us ordering them and they looked delicious. Actually they looked massive and could easily be shared.   Really not going to hold the issue with timing against them. They are a new spot and obviously need to work out some kinks in their operation. Our waiter was super polite and we think he will be just fine as soon as he masters that touch pad. He did comp the appetizer and our drinks. Manager never came to table to apologize but we are sure he signed off on the comp. Also did not get a good night when we walked out and past the hostess - but thats OK.   We will be back. It's a really nice casual spot and very reasonably priced for the amount of food they give you. Great location and it should do just fine.

LK2p6hAfrwvYVI7NXBGBWA.text: One of my favorite restaurants over the past 15 years. Great food is an understatement. Service is great, which is the norm. Nice atmosphere.   One curious thing though, I started to eat at the Green Valley Pkwy bar, and I have to say this, they have the most UNCOMFORTABLE bar chairs/stools a human can experience. Seriously, PAINFUL. Please look into getting something that doesn't pain your customers to sit in!

YywfHPXRP01kjow_GomB2g.text: The Tequila Chicken is amazing!  They also have 2 happy hours each day with great appetizer deals.

2h-_6cAyrkOlkUHww1AgWw.text: Loved it when it first opened. Last couple of times it seems as though they either sold it or did a HUGE cost cutting. Portions are smaller. Bottomless mimosas were 90% orange juice. Not cool.

xISf752lV1pgHGAZX9k-Lw.text: We've brought out-of-town guests to the Henderson location a couple times and both the food and service is outstanding! Duck tacos, Brussel sprouts, pizza, sliders, salad, wings.....everything is so tasty!

QXZ9LtpMlkbgMhACzZ3TAw.text: We go to game and eat since they have an excellent bar/gaming area for adults. The food is really good and we've yet to order anything that I wouldn't order again. As for the bar keep Mikey, well I must say he has well over 20 years experience running a bar in Vegas and you won't find a better place to have a drink, shot the bull and be well taken care of. The machines play rather well considering how low most places have them set. Excellent place to meet friends, eat dinner, play some machines or just hide out from the horrible over bearing GV drivers for a while!   Before you take "certain" bad reviews to heart and bypass Sammy's, click on the reviewers name and see if they appear to take great pleasure in slamming 99% of the places they visit. Good scam for getting comps and freebies while misleading people into not trying certain places, such as this great establishment for instance!

GRFi9o21nkkHzYpi0ehiCg.text: I have been to two previous locations.  This one is by the the most visually appealing. The lay out is different than all the others. They have a wonderful bar area next to a full glass window wall that opens up, the fresh air is great reminds me of California style restaurants.  Appetizers : Asian style calamari ( very unique) I highly suggest this.  Hot Rock: 600 degree rock in a bed of salt, and you get to cook your own beef on it. Very tasty and interesting. Also we had Vietnamese crab stack. That was really good and fresh with real crab, and a little lemon grass ginger flavor.  Had a glass of Pinot and the shrimp and grits . Very good, not something I would ever order, I was being spontaneous that day. The waiter suggested it and it was a GREAT suggestion.The grits are not like grits at all, not a single gritty grain actually. Made very well with a stack of steamed greens.  Our waiter was very nice. His name was Zack. Its rare you find people who actually enjoy their job. There is nothing that makes your food taste worst than a fake good mood. We certainly didn't get it with this guy. He is much appreciated, and made my birthday great.  I love the new location, and will be back regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Fudge nut Birthday explosion

h5YNV5s8ueaY5vRD8iFmaA.text: We like going to Sammy's... but every time we step in the door we remember how horrible the service always is. The food is great, just an awful lack of service that doesn't match the the dollar signs here. We were seated to our table and waited 7mins until we were greeted and once we told our server our beverage order, she disappeared for another 4mins to grab our waters and my boyfriend's tall Blue Moon. Then, although we were beyond ready to order our food, she disappeared for another  5mins. We were really hungry and really impatient at that point. We felt bad but we just grabbed our drinks and made our way to the bar, as she was taking way too long. The table next to us even noticed our irritation, as they sat there with the same irritation because they had been sitting for a while without service too. As we got up and moved ourselves to the bar, that table next us got up and left the establishment. We obviously told the bartender why we moved and he apologized but hardly had any urgency and the manager was even right there and she didn't even care! It was a rather lengthy late night dinner and we're definitely disappointed, as we always are when we leave Sammy's. Can't come here when I'm in a hurry that's for sure. Guess I'll stick with California Pizza Kitchen for similar menu items and much better service. Doesn't ever get any better at Sammy's unfortunately.

BUcRk--rf6phZER61tEZ2Q.text: Great salad. We discovered an error a week later. Manager graciously took care of it.  Good food great people.

_RmTGapd8gkY6TiMrn0BZQ.text: I ate the entire pizza. The whole thing. To myself. Then I shamefully googled, "best juice cleanses" shortly after. The pizza is worth the guilt. Will be back for more.

cimfZjit-JahcE0cBa1S2A.text: The second time I went here- they missed a topping on the pizza so they put topping on pizza and refired it- which is a no no- great way to give someone food poisoning . and service was terrible.  We decided to try again- since the first time was not bad.  It took 10 minutes to get seated for lunch and then we waited with three children another ten minutes and never saw a server -   so we left and will not be back

ifXoNn8vbyLOyTAKH8dyBg.text: Was meeting up with an old friend and thought we would try out their brunch. First let me start with this...$20 bottomless mimosas! Oh yes! So delicious and they do not hold back on making sure you're refilled when needed. We shared the charcuterie plate which was delicious. Had more mimosas and then she had the breakfast pizza and I had the breakfast tacos. All so tasty! I must say, our server Brian was fantastic and helped make for an amazing brunch!

wL6am-mGFbfOWtH7WzwDVA.text: Food is amazing. The pizza is spectacular. They serve out of the box recipes, so if you're feeling adventurous for a new restaurant, this is the place to go. The decor is also nice and cozy.   The only downside is how loud it is. The kitchen is not closed off so that creates a lot of background noise and the restaurant doesn't have sectioned walls for seating so noise is traveling throughout. I had to yell at my boyfriend even though he was right in front of me. Kind of ruined the moment.   I would just order for pick up if you want it to be intimate or want to be able to have a conversation with the person you are with.

7gYD47WRGf55gWlWHD8rWQ.text: Walk in, the young man greets us pleasantly as the woman with dark colored hair sweeping the floor- looks at her watch in a rude manner and makes a sound like we are cramping her style as the nice young man offers to seat us.  The last tine we came to Sami's the same female was rude- same thing is happening... WHY DO WORK IN SERVICE IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO BE IN SERVICE?  Now it's the end of the meal- she became nice in a forced manner.  Keaton was amazingly friendly. YHE FOOD IS ALWAYS CONSISTENTLY YUMMY!!! The service is always touch and go, bummer. Samies, is it possible for service and food to match in quality?

vrgUUbhBg96boLTsRZZtzw.text: Terrible service!!! We were celebrating Father's Day with the family. There were 2 open booths, so we asked for a booth & the hostess said she just sat people there & stuck us on a table between 2 large parties. The waiter came by 10 minutes after we were seated & apologized for his delay & took our drink & food order & left. We noticed that no one ever sat at those booths & now there were 2 more booths available so we asked again for a booth & were sat at a booth. Twenty minutes later our food came & was on its way back to the kitchen since our original table was empty & they thought we left the restaurant. We flagged them down & complained to the manager that our drinks were still not out. She made a face & said she'll check on it. The food was good & the waiter added a free dessert but disappeared again & after waiting for 15 minutes for him to pick up our payment, I walked over to the kitchen and handed him my credit card. Worst Service Ever in a restaurant which was mildly busy. I called the restaurant 25 minutes later & was extremely disappointed AGAIN...  Horrible Customer Service! We left the restaurant angry because of the terrible service on Father's Day & forgot our left over to go bag on the table. Less than 30 minutes later I called the restaurant & the hostess tells me they tossed the bag because no one ever comes back for pick up after they leave the place.  We eat out a lot as a family & these guys have the worst customer practices of anything I've experienced so far in Henderson, Nevada.

hEbURbE4gEoqALGLysxqQQ.text: What a beautiful location. We were on our way back from Lake Mead so we stopped by here for a quick bite. We were seated near the door next to the lovely green outdoor garden. With the cool breezes flowing around us, we enjoyed looking at the fake but beautiful orchid and green plants, as well as munching on the fish tacos, lobster bisque, chicken lettuce cup and even a few beers! Even though I thought they were rather salty, I liked them and I would totally come back to try more items!

O9Py8sERs_BQduriA95ToA.text: Where are you Marcus????? I come here because you are awesome to ALL the patrons !!! I hate it when I don't see you... Although I won't lie Miss Alesia doesn't take second place very kindly..... She makes it a little easier to be without you... EEK! Please don't poison me... Miss you and love you both for ALL you do to take care of the locals who love SAMMYS and promote this family owned and operated business since waaaaay......waaaaaay back in the day. This is a great spot for EVERYTHING!!

FFg9HF_XzvYsS5mu112U1Q.text: Just got done with my second visit to Sammy's this time during happy hour with my homegirl (her first time). I love the ambiance of this restaurant; the openness of the atrium room is really inviting and more importantly- they play good, hip music.   During Happy Hour, the mixed drinks are 50% off with majority of the drinks being around $12. The wine is $2 off and beer $1 off. Happy Hour runs from 3-6p, 7 days a week- not too shabby. Also, the appetizers are on sale!m during Happy Hour.   My friend ordered the mini duck tacos, which she said were fantastic. The duck has great texture and the veggies sprinkled on top were nice and fresh. For her main course she tried the Wagyu Mini Sliders. These came with the lettuce/tomatoes and onions on the side with a huge side of crispy fries. The Wagyu Sliders were nice and juice +the cheddar slice on top- perfect!   Tonight I tried the Shrimp Angel Pasta. The lobster cream sauce atop this is so creamy and delicious. It also comes with artichokes, mushrooms and zucchini slices. Not too heavy, yet filling!   As much as I want to give 5 Stars, unfortunately there was a mix up in the kitchen and our food took longer than expected. Two other tables nearby (which walked in after us) revived there food way before us. Also, I would liked our server to check in on us more than what we experienced tonight.   Other than that, I liked how the manager remembered me from my Yelp Elite Week experience from two weeks ago! He walked up and said, "your back!" That's cool he remembered me!

wD-w7KD2U-t4UxTwTS7gRQ.text: Thanks.......  Just great service Saturday night !! Got it a bit late versus our regular times.  Sat at the bar..... Wow.....  Brandon and Dion, were spot on.   Great team.... Water , wine and orders in, in the blink of an eye.  There are days when that is particularly appreciated.  Saturday was one !!  Thanks Dion and Brandon !!

5H66BodBzRuvkvkIA4L8CA.text: My friend and I had an awesome dinner at Sammy's! The food and the service were both awesome.  We were greeted and seated as soon as we walked in. Both my friend and I are pretty challenged when it comes to making menu decisions. Sammy's has so many awesome menu options it can make it even harder to decide. However our waiter was super helpful and patient with us.   We ended up getting the poke and hot rock steak appetizer, the burratta and heirloom tomato salad, tequila lime chicken fettuccine, pear and prosciutto pizza and lastly the sticky toffee pudding dessert. Every dish was delicious! Definitely can't wait to come back!

2KdOKadDufiWPXiiOoZAEg.text: The food was pretty good but the service was awful. Young girl chatting with the bartender not listening or doing her job.  This is my 3rd time trying this place and disappointed again. We went for happy hour but sat at a table.

IAsLDuWs-9eNY-kVhNXztg.text: Sammy's is really good and always consistent. The service is always great.   I've come here for lunch and it's always busy.   Happy hour is a really good deal with half off of appetizers and drink specials. Good for a get together and sharing and trying different appetizers.   My favorite dishes are the duck tacos, Brussels sprouts, and the chicken tequila fettuccine.   The gaming bar is open 24 hours. Good food and great service no matter what time of day you come.

Pi44MJozkol4eZ66TXcMVQ.text: We always love Sammy's.  We happen to go during happy hour where all the shareable apps are 1/2 price!   How can you go wrong with that?  So we loaded up on the apps and ordered  Poke Calamari Duck tacos Garlic bread   All the apps were on point.   The main dish not so much. Ordered the Alfredo and it was runny and watery.  But staff was gracious enough to replace it with spaghetti which was pretty good.    The star was the crispy donuts with raspberry sauce and chocolate.  Delicious!!!

5FSMX0U93A_JDczmY6zgHQ.text: This place is a clown act. The manager doesn't know a thing about restaurants. I told her I didn't want it. I said you had three conversations over my food & I don't want it. People spit when they talk. I sent it back. They told me never to come back. Ef them. Like they are setting the world on fire with business. They are slowly ruining the place.

JcYhExTlXD1BCHuWJx5qTQ.text: We love Sammy's!  Great restaurant in Green Valley... we love to come here especially in the Spring and Fall when they have the whole side of the restaurant open.  Took my mom and sister to brunch for Mother's Day and they had a wonderful musician singing and playing guitar while we ate delicious food and enjoyed the beautiful weather.  I couldn't have asked for a better way to spend Mother's Day!

1nx-UzJmE76cKQi6OmmiOw.text: Looking for a nice place for lunch on a Saturday (or any other day), Sammy's is a great choice!  They have a good assortment to choose from - pizza, soups, salads, pastas, a good assortment of finger foods and deserts.  They also have a kids menu.  This location is always clean and the staff is always friendly and courteous.  There is plenty of parking behind he building.  We started off with garlic cheese bread.  Like a cheese and garlic pizza without the sauce.  An Asian sampler - skewers of grilled shrimp, a couple pot stickers with dipping sauce, and a couple skewers of satay chicken in a peanut sauce.  Followed by a mozzarella cheese and pepperoni pizza.  Ended with a Messy Sunday!  We were lucky enough to get Raychelle as our server, so was had a great time!  Definitely a place to go back again and again!

c3pUq2SBwlzAfyhCe1gxQQ.text: I love this place! Out of all Sammy's in the valley this one is my favorite. The food is delicious and they offer good variety. I've also been here for brunch. Beautiful restaurant, a lot of windows which gives way to natural light. On this particular night, I got take out after work around midnight (since I work in the industry). We met Ray the graveyard bartender. He was super friendly, very attentive, and overall good attitude which makes us wanna come back even more! We got the chicken balsamic salad, garlic cheesy bread, and NY pizza- all good. Thanks Ray!

c9OHpwNmx-qxL-xocpMR3w.text: I couldn't wait to brag about my server, Chris Barr:  The word "Incredibly" goes in front of all of these words:  Personable Outgoing Reliable Flexible because we changed up the menu Quick And the list can go on for days!  Never a bad meal....I think I've here 25 times or more!!!

1zjHDVXWM0ghZVImq1tBFw.text: This Sammy's has the nicest interior that I have been to with an open air feel and couches at some tables. The food did not disappoint and consistent between Sammy's. At the lunch hour, the server seamed a bit overwhelmed as she looked to be serving and bussing tables. I think the restaurant could add one more server or busser to take help out the flow

3-nOX0zN9csi4stNIiTDHA.text: We visited sammys on Sunday brunch. Honestly I wasn't aware they had brunch so that was a nice surprise. We opted out of ordering off the brunch menu but it did look really good. I ordered a personal pizza , I don't eat cheese so I ordered a Sicilian without the cheese and onion. I very much enjoyed the pizza. It had lots of pepperoni, sausage, peppers and sans onion. The crust was chewy and crispy at the same time. The whole pizza in general was crispy. I'm assuming because I had no cheese. The bf pizza was a little soggy but still great flavor. The server picked up on the fact I don't dairy and was kind enough to let me know the sauce has cheese so she was able to switch it to marinara. Great service, great food, giant beers. Awesome!

SiePWAz-aNwDSifzM2f3mw.text: Went there for dinner -good service and friendly people. If you order a salad stay away from the  "grilled chicken"! It is definitely frozen and microwaved. Tasted like rubber and looked unappetizing.

8pRVeGoSl3yWZr4OmVMp3A.text: So I went to Sammys Woodfire Pizza in Green Valley on Sunday night and sat in the bar and I must say Dion was a great bartender not only does he know how to make the best drinks he is also just a nice all around guy explained the menu to me what I should order I have to say the duck tacos are amazing. I will definitely be coming back there again and sitting in the bar with Dion he is very knowledgeable. He gave great service.

2kIhIpzSv_oHBNdwLlcVIw.text: So I love coming into Sammy's every  weekend. Whether it's Dion at the main bar or Alesia in the gaming bar. Love the service and awesome personalities. Chris Mata is always amazing from his customer service to his cocktails. Overall great staff!

XFslizGFVWVjzise5et5LA.text: Half off appetizers, cocktails, and $2 off shots from 3-6pm for happy hour!  Tonight we had the duck tacos, meatballs and mozzarella, truffle fries, Kung pao calamari, and the hot stone steak. Everything was delicious, and service was on point!

VU92EPd_-Gx3NuYtj3YNdA.text: We were looking for a reasonably priced, family dinner with Gluten free and Keto diets in mind.  Angela was awesome and suggested the Arugula and Pear pizza on a cauliflower crust. I'm normally a pepperoni pizza person, but I took a leap and WOW. IT WAS GREAT!  Everyone in our group with special diets were accommodated and loved their meal. It was reasonable and delicious with fantastic service!

dDAcrMhpv3YIMMzLH8Q3oA.text: Kristy is best waitress ever on restaurant planet. Food is great here, as is the wine selection. Recomend the Henderson location highly.

TMtt6IRRWirEg9_jMgF9dQ.text: This location is in a sorta strange spot as it's part of a business complex. But it's decorated nicely and has a good ambiance. It has both the normal restaurant area, as well as a 24/7 tavern, gaming area. Service is attentive and friendly in both areas. And hey, I hit 4-of-a-kind twice here, so that's pretty awesome. Happy hour is 4-6pm and has multiple small appetizers and drinks on special. The apps are smaller portions than the regular apps, so you aren't exactly saving a bunch of money. But it is nice in that it allows you to try out multiple apps, as opposed to getting full on just one. All of the food I've had here has been great. I love their goat cheese pizza. And the mac 'n' cheese is fab. I wish they still had the kobe beef hummus, but the regular hummus is still tasty. The meatballs are pretty good too. All in all, this is a great place to play, dine, and do happy hour.

976uMgCnhwio4UMpAUEucg.text: Had an incredible customer service experience this evening. Two to three servers tag teamed my table so all my needs were met in a timely manner. On top of that, when I went to order my salad, the server was honest and said some people did not care for the dressing because it is quite tangy and recommended I have it on the side. That turned out to be a great recommendation! I appreciate honesty and great service & will definitely be back!

hVJocLUQgkdj15YgeinMCw.text: Sammy's was a super last resort dinner spot for us. nothing super spectacular, but good options and nice happy hour.   But... My boyfriend was on a vendor lunch with work clients and someone in his party found a grasshopper in her salad.  So for that reason, I'm out.

K1bqSRIjKcx2aTlSdaZF0g.text: Kobe Chili is amazing! Service way to slow considering the restaurant was only 20% full. Had to ask for refills, etc.  Chinese chicken salad was spicier than other restaurants.

2MH0T3d4OoIgSj-9fGiqkA.text: I was busy the evening of the Elite event at Sammy's so I did not get to attend... So when my sweet friend Jaime W. asked if she could take me here for brunch to celebrate my birthday I was stoked to check out the place so many of my Yelp friends had raved about.   This is a gorgeous restaurant! I loved the beautiful decor...  It felt like we were dining on an island somewhere. I was also excited to see that a friend was being trained as a waitress while we were there... Sometimes it can be annoying to get a trainee as your waiter or waitress, but I enjoyed getting to see a familiar face (and she didn't make any major mistakes while serving us).   As beautiful as the interior of Sammy's is, there were a few things that needed some work. I originally wanted one of the special 'handcrafted juice refreshers'  but they were unavailable. So I decided to get a mimosa, we were celebrating my birthday after all. Mimosas are listed as $8 on the menu with a $10 all-you-can-drink advertised as a Sunday special... but somehow, my single mimosa was $10.   The highlight of the meal, for me, was the adorable little donuts that we started with. They were served with chocolate and raspberry sauces and were super delicious.  The breakfast burrito I got was large, but just ok taste-wise.   Sammy's staff was generous enough to give me a free dessert for my birthday, the Messy Sundae. It  was rather cool looking but uninspired in terms of flavor and very  difficult to eat.  Overall, I enjoyed my initial visit to Sammy's enough to want to go back sometime. Hopefully some of the kinks will have been worked out by the time I do so!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Donuts: small on size but big on taste

yWKh9vwHnkYn0RNGJb4uIQ.text: I must say that we had a great experience this time our server Jenna was awesome! Great attitude and excellent service. Food was great as usual and the service top notch this time.

cQgGfsYSEW8vOq-akEwEQQ.text: The seating at this Sammy's is better that the other ones. A little more sit down restaurant vibe. Our server Rachel was very friendly and nice!

XHUa6u8xTFlhUwitVQVJHg.text: My friend Sarah Jane invited me to the Sammy's elite event as her plus 1, but when she wasn't able to make it. She somehow got me invited with a plus 1 to the Sammy's VIP event a few nights later. I love that girl!  This was a complete success from start to finish. They executed this event perfectly. I was greeted at the door and she easily found my name. My friend wasn't there yet, so she wrote her name next to mine and assured me she would have no issues getting in.   As I walked in I was greeted by more people, one offered me a glass of champagne. I went to the bar and almost immediately someone came up to me to offer a slice of pizza. The flow of the food was perfectly timed. It seemed just as I would finish one thing someone else was offering me a new item. Pretty much every thing I tried was delicious. The pizzas were great. My two absolute favorites were the Goat Cheese (Sauteed mushrooms, garlic spinach and red onion - which I took off) and Five Cheese (Gouda, Raclette, Romano, Mozzarella, and Gorgonzola - perfect). The Garlic chicken was my least favorite, although I did like the BBQ Chicken (Smoked Gouda, BBQ Sauce, Cilantro - I removed the ren onion, of course)  The duck tacos were great. I really liked the tomato/cilantro sauce. Duck is definitely one of my most under eaten but favorite meats. I love when a restaurant isn't afraid to use it. They also had a duck quesadilla that was pretty delicious. I was in duck heaven.   Some other yummy things that I tried: Some kind of tuna on a cracker - perfect and some kind of fish tacos. Both were good, but I really liked the tuna. The specialty cracker (it didn't really taste like a regular cracker) paired perfectly with the tuna. I could have eaten 100 of those. So good!!  One of the only things I didn't like too much was the hummus. I'm not sure exactly what about it. Maybe I was just stuffed as it was one of the last things I tried, but I think I just didn't like it.   Even the house red wine they were serving was pretty good. I tried a few of the specialty cocktails and although they were good. I'm not a cocktail girl.  Everyone was so friendly. Great customer service. We sat at the bar the majority of the night and even though the staff seemed very busy they were attentive. The venue is awesome. Large bar right in the middle. There's an atrium style room to one side with large windows. There's also going to be a tavern open 24/7 linked to the restaurant.   I can't wait to come back on Thursday for ladies night. Ladies drink 2 for 1 8pm to 12am and also to try the mac and cheese, made with Tillamook Cheddar, my favorite!

VfF_cpPyFhKw_ZnMOSeDOQ.text: Our server was horrible he opens up with "y'all want anything to drink" which I was like ok mannerisms are lacking for a place like this but ok. So we than place our drink orders. He than comes back after 12min exactly and tells me if he can help us. Which I said my wife still waiting on her tea. He brings the tea and I ask about my water. And place a order for hummus some guy not my waiter brings it out quickly enough. But my server took another 13min to come back and ask if we wanted anything to eat by this time I ask for the check. He than say "oh wow so soon ok" in a smart a$$ type of way. Brings my check with no pen I do not know of it was my skin color or what but seem like everyone else was getting quick servers.. I'll never take my business to that one the one on Shara is amazing and will now only go to that one!

woG3_YK0ADMO-2gFfhPyqg.text: The combination of the chicken balsamic salad and the service will get me to come back for another visit (and it is two blocks away) the service was great I had my two kids and they were a handful and everyone was super helpful  Will update with more after round 2

skJywltZbnoah-dbCwI0pQ.text: After the yelp elite event (which was fantastic) I knew I had to return to Sammy's for a meal.  I'm glad I did.  I had lunch on a weekday and it was busy.  Not packed, but at least half full.  Very brisk business.  I sat in the kind of half couch tables that face the bar.  VERY comfortable and unique.  Had a good view of the TV, but you have to turn your head slightly.  Service was a little spotty as the bartender was busy.  This is why I usually don't sit in the bar area at restaurants when I am dining.  However, once I ordered, my food was out very quickly.  I had the sliders with fries and added gorgonzola cheese.  Fantastic.  The bun is soft and toasty and did not fall apart.  This was particularly impressive as the burger was JUICY.  The patties are flavorful.  I could use a little more of the sauce, next time I order them I'll probably ask for more on the side.  The fries are good, thin and crispy with some nice seasoning.    Cool design and atmosphere with a comprehensive menu.  We'll definitely come back.

E6IbzlTul43Y17gYHtumeQ.text: Had an amazing dining experience! Definitely recommend this place. Freshly made food, way more than a pizza place! Jonathan the GM is a delightful person

uGTADgdxZyJoYgSJwXSZGA.text: Happy hour.Live music. The mini duck tacos are sooooo  yummy. Happy Hour has great nosh options and prices for food. Drinks aren't  great prices for happy hour but they are delicious. The bartender is handsome and makes a great cocktail.
