Bb1aZNo2lIUjdisg8wyBrw.text: We ate at Sammy's for the first time Feb 13th. The food was tasty, and our server Albert was very helpful in selecting dishes to try. Looking at the restaurant from the outside, it looks like a typical dark bar/eatery, but what a nice surprise when you come inside. My only suggestion is that Sammy's should have rice as a side dish, it would have really complimented several of the menu "shareables".

TU9SDxE0yYm_SP-pgeCuqw.text: Great food and fantastic service. Dawn always made sure we were taken care of. The eggs Benedict are the best I've had, banana walnut Pancakes were amazing.

pArRuNEHZ3gCkMbbPyRJ2A.text: Food is great, but the service is terrible. Waited for 15 minutes for any wait staff to come to our table after being seated at 3:45pm--not crowded. Husbands food came out at least 5 min after my daughter and I got ours. No one checked on us until 10 minutes after we finished our food. Annoying!

GuqeRiB-OV_bNw3s-miGTQ.text: Was surprised to see this restaurant so slow for a Saturday night. We walked in and were sat immediately. Service was fast and friendly. The drinks came quickly and so did the refills. We ordered a Sicilian pizza and a large salad. Pizza was delicious and so was the salad. Grilled chicken on top of the salad was warm. The salad was large enough for two people. Don't make the mistake of ordering that whole thing for yourself. I really can't complain about any of it. The atmosphere is above and beyond what I would expect for a Sammys. I would go here with my friends.

08daCCgxiRMOu2Vq491zvQ.text: A good friend recommended I try Sammy's for a casual business lunch.  First impression was of a pleasant decor and intriguing menu. But my salad was awful.  They appeared to be understaffed by at least one server as we waited and waited for iced tea refills, which finally came with no ice so we drank warm tea.  I didn't plan on going back, but my wife wanted to see if we might have a better experience my second time.  We did.  She really liked the sliders and I ordered a different salad (the balsamic chicken) which was quite good.  Still seemed to be understaffed though.  One more quality waiter would really improve the timing of their service.

lfUfhBmmtgcLX3mWbMVMYw.text: I frequent Sammys on GV Pkwy, I eat in the restaurant and I gamble at the bar. The food is always amazing and the bar service with Mandy is exceptional!

HeJxr6m5jx8R1yQWmI_yMg.text: Wow! I recently went to Sammy's (Green Valley) for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised!  I had driven by this place so many times and just never really gotten a chance to check it out until a friend recommended that I try it for happy hour.  Shared plates are half price during happy hour (they have plenty to choose from: pot stickers, satay, lettuce cups, calamari, hummus, baba ghanoush, shrimp, poke, duck tacos, meatballs, etc.) and they have specialty cocktails, wine, and beer also at a discounted price during happy hour.  They also offer pizza, burgers, salads, pastas, roasted meats and fish, and yummy desserts (warm doughnuts, anyone?).   The Green Valley space is actually quite elegant and the service is the best! Our gal Kristie took such great care of us - kept our drinks full and our bellies happy. She was a lot of fun too!   I'm so glad that I can add Sammy's to my list of local spots to enjoy. I hear they offer a fantastic weekend brunch too!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Messy Sundae!
Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Warm doughnuts

npZ812QZ4PTp2OnBBK07nA.text: Update:  Sammy's Manager followed up with us regards our recent experience, Christy was very responsive and addressed our concerns. Thank you.

3YMG6P3QIP1QBfgycX4d9w.text: What a find!!!  My wife & I travel quite a bit all over the country.  We always are looking for a local place with good healthy choices at reasonable prices.  In my opinion, Sammy's tops them all!  Too many options & too little time but here's what we had:  Crisp Brussels Sprouts. I was a little skeptical but they were charred perfectly and the glaze was great.   Tuscan Kale & Romaine Salad.  Lots of almonds & cranberries so I was happy. The sherry-Dijon dressing could be a little overpowering but we got it on the side so we could adjust to individual taste. Individual size was plenty for two.     New York Style Pizza on wheat crust.  Great pizza on the perfect crust!  Portions were generous so we more than had our fill & took home some of everything.   It is hard to top the food but the service was even better than the food.  From the time we were greeted at the door to the manager stopping by our table to make sure everything was perfect.  But our waiter, Ricardo was the best; attentive & knowledgeable and very friendly and helpful throughout our meal.  They even had cotton candy for dessert (a favorite of my wife)!  Ps. The beer was cold.  The only disappointment of the evening was the Black Knights lost 2-1 in double OT.

gA4ehCmGY9n5jpPPmaHokA.text: DOES NOT GET IT "How not to run a restaurant." Let the rant begin. Came for the first time for Happy Hour. First off, $2.00 off of beer and wine. Big deal. Then ordered a spicy margarita. "We don't do those. Don't have peppers." Then I had a coupon and were told, "can't use coupon (on full price menu) and happy hour saving $2 on a beer." The money is not the issue. The issue is not winning over a customer over a few bucks. Once we got our food it was good. Best balsamic chicken salad in Vegas. Bottom line, good food but the management doesn't get it. Lost a customer over a few bucks.

XE06OyMzHEbiGrJeOlVifw.text: This is our local restaurant. Great variety of food, great ambience and always excellent service from our server Ricardo. Also the food is very reasonably price and they have go to happy hour pricing to. The pizza is excellent. Tonight we had the salmon entree, which was perfectly cooked and season. Will be back again and again and again. PS the homemade hummus is fantastic!

69OCvk8eGRPzXuU3jabkeA.text: My husband used to love this place and actually built 1 of their locations , he told me their pizza is great so I decided to give it a try...  the service was good , the biggest pizza was tiny , and %90 of it was covered with fresh basil which made it horrible... and don't get me wrong we love basil but not at this amount... also the price was pretty expensive for what you getting...don't think I'll go back...

y_dfnp9I_PJmkg6WopQsXQ.text: We came in for my Mother's birthday dinner Sunday night and we all had a really nice time and our waitress Christina C. Was really friendly and on top of everything.  Thank you Christina for making my moms bday dinner perfect.

O9Q4But5-W6VBznBwVCnwA.text: One of the very few restaurants in our neighborhood that offers " Happy Hour" on Sunday afternoons. And it's great. Half off most of there appetizers and great deals on drinks. Although at times it can be fairly crowded, it's a great way to end the weekend and not have to cook dinner.

8TskJlhFWS-q6tNzRaLrFg.text: Kristie was our server for lunch and she was absolutely wonderful.  I had the balsamic chicken salad and my husband had the oak roasted chicken.  They changed the recipe on the oak roasted chicken recently and it was even better than the original.  Kristie was very attentive, she made sure we had everything we needed and made our visit special.

IGH6u0pY9Jr28kYO7xWtDg.text: Brandon at the bar is amazing! Very attentive & informative! Asked us to sign up for the royalty program & suggested amazing drinks! We love to come when he's here! Food is great too!

n7ne02LdPNOdWRwOhkaeWA.text: Came in for happy hour with some friends Christian was so nice and really answered all out questions. He was so patient and im so exckted to come back and win some more money!

bNPTwyDG2tP96YHQSZZffg.text: Brandon and Dion are amazing. The food is wonderful, and different and the service is incredible.

0X9cjTLaUbslN5PuzbrtnA.text: Service was superB! Sat down and was greeted immediately by the bartender Dion. He was very attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu.   I was there to meet a friend and just have a beer but somehow Dion twisted my arm to have a couple whiskeys on the rocks . I'll definitely be back just for the service !  Also, Brussels sprouts were A1!

DUm-8AWfRFV8sqcXVAYJdw.text: I enjoyed Sammy's! Came here for dinner with some girl friends from work.  We ordered two (vegan) appetizers:  -Brussels sprouts without cheese  -Walnuts & olives  They were totally delicious-- especially the roasted Brussels sprouts with balsamic vinegar!  -Most Pizza crusts are vegan. -the marinara is vegan, not pizza sauce--it has cheese. -They have Daiya mozzarella cheese.   I ordered a pizza with whole wheat crust, marinara, spinach, olives, onions, bell peppers, artichokes & sundried tomatoes. It was wonderful! (I would normally order the vegan cheese, but I am not a fan of Daiya)  The server was wonderful! Very knowledgeable and accommodating.   I will be back!

Ab2sqJ-L_mJgNNyr-uTMpQ.text: I recently came to Sammy's with a group of gals for a lunch meeting. It was a Sunday and the place was pretty dead, maybe only 2-3 other tables had people. The location is a short drive away from the 215 and in front of some office buildings.   For my meal I went with the Thin Crust Brie & Truffle pizza. They were offering both brunch options and lunch, but pizza just sounded right to me. The timing of our entrees was a little slow, maybe about 10 minutes from the first plate being received to the last. That was a bit disappointing, but the food was great. My pizza was hot & fresh. I loved the cracker thin crust and it had plenty of cheese.   I'm sure I'll be back at Sammy's again in the future. I'd like to try to come for a dinner next time for a little more liveliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Thin Crust Brie Cheese and Truffle Oil Pizza

AbjWQ2qd73szsQZgX2xnrA.text: We were in the neighborhood Sunday evening visiting some family and decided to try somewhere on this side of town for dinner before heading home. We choose Sammy's based on the reviews.  Pulling into the parking lot it seemed pretty busy. Upon entering the restaurant we were in a small line about 3 couples deep. We only had to wait about 5 minutes for them to get to us.   The guy asked if we'd like to sit near the bar. We said okay. After being seated we realized the seats were really soft. We didn't like how we were sinking down and back into them. When he was walking by a minute or two later we told him we'd decided we'd rather sit at a table. He asked us to wait a couple of minutes while he got a table ready.  A few minutes later we were moved to a table which we found much more comfortable, although the yelling kid behind us was a little annoying.  So finally seated I started checking the place out. I really liked how it looked. We perused the menu. I had decided on the Maui Tacos. It seemed we'd been there awhile. No one even came and brought us any water or asked if we'd like anything from the bar. Usually moments after you're seated someone is with you. They might not be ready to take your order yet, but they let you know they'll be right with you.  Looking around I saw 5 empty tables that needed to be cleaned up. The customers had eaten and left. I was starting to get the picture Enter the restaurant and wait to be seated. Asked to be moved...waited for that. Seated at a table no one to assist us. They were obviously short handed tonight. I really didn't want to order food and have to wait for it and then have it arrive cold because they were short handed.  At this point we decided to leave and find somewhere that we weren't getting a vibe that they were too busy to assist us promptly.  Well you know what they say you only get one chance to make a first impression, and this first impression wasn't great.   So we're giving it two stars based on this visit. If we're in the neighborhood sometime in the future we might try it again.

M2jSbkE_Xj08a0vHUKIoVg.text: Before my Yelping days my husband and I frequented this restaurant. We always loved the food and atmosphere, but the service was consistently terrible so we stopped coming here. This past weekend we decided to return and see if they've improved. Our service was great and we can now gladly add this back as one of our go to spots near home.   The inside of the restaurant has a beach/Florida theme. Plenty of windows allow for a bright dining room. The atmosphere is lively and a little noisy without being too loud. This would be a good spot for families since kids likely wouldn't be heard by surrounding tables.   The menu offers a great variety of food items. They have a large list of appetizers, pastas, tacos, burgers, salads, pizzas, entrees, and desserts. They offer light options as well as heartier meals.   Our waitress was pleasant and attentive. She was around checking on us frequently and made sure we had drink refills.   Chicken Lettuce Cups were a delicious starter. The mixture of chicken, hoisin sauce, and vegetables worked well together. Asian Shrimp Pasta was my choice of entree for the evening. Everything in this dish was great and the peanut sauce was very tasty. The peanut sauce did make for a very rich dish so I'm not sure I'd order this again, but it did taste great. My husband went with the Spicy Italian Sausage and said it was a good pizza.   I'm so glad to report that my recent Sammy's experience was better than the last!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken Lettuce Cups
Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Asian Shrimp Pasta

Lf6NfSmQ6GQBAKgmUYSJJA.text: This is our go to date night restaurant. Their food and drinks are always good. The hot rock and duck tacos are a must, we get them every time we go. We try to go during happy hour (daily 3-6), since their cocktails and shareables are half off. But even if we miss it, the prices are decent and we never feel like it's too expensive. Our dad has to eat gluten free and he enjoys the pizza here. They are really good about making sure nothing touches his pizza/ other food. If you like sweets and are a desserts person, they are known for their cotton candy and messy sundae. Tip: if you check in on yelp, you get a messy sundae for free!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Messy Sundae free with check in
Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour menu. This location is from 3-6 daily.

pl4OS4MMFZopzNDcG5tmDw.text: Christian is the best bartender I've ever had,caters to my every need. Food is amazeing had the best time with him! Thank you christian!

6nIiT8OoVfl3j1v5rlLQ4w.text: We live pretty close to Sammy's and have eaten here a few times before, but it has been a few years.  This is what we ordered:  Mini Duck Tacos-I was very surprised I liked this dish! The duck was crispy but tender. Loved the flavors of the cilantro and feta added with it. It was a perfect appetizer.   Spicy Thai Grilled Chicken Salad-very delicious, but it wasn't spicy at all. I loved the fresh herbs and the perfectly grilled chicken. Just a little too many peanuts added.   Sicilian Pizza-So good! I can't believe I never ordered a pizza here before. The crust was perfectly soft and crunchy. Normally I don't eat the crust because it's either too crispy or flavorless without the sauce and cheese but this dough was delicious. I also loved their sauce. It was so fresh with a touch of spice.

Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Spicy Thai Grilled Chicken Salad

1ZGD9Bt1k7JLZIR9aiGjdg.text: I love the intimate setting. Service was great. Prices are fair.   My boyfriend and I usually order different entrees so we could steal bites from each other's plates, but we both thought the chicken tequila fettuccine sounded good.  And it was! It's a spinach fettuccine with bell peppers, onions and tequila-lime cream sauce. Maybe the cream was a tad bit too rich for us, but it was delectable nonetheless.  Looking at the pics, I'm bummed out we didn't find room in our tummies for dessert! The messy Sundae and the mini donuts look so good! I can't wait to go back for those!

fRma101Ct1z2Hd5MSqhSaA.text: The restaurant is good but the 24 hour bar is my favorite hangout. Jamie the bartender is personable  and always upbeat. He remembers what you drink when you come back. Definitely a locals gem. The food is good. Machines are a bit tight but we go back because of Jamie.

fCgJ4O8j4PTYffDRGRibkQ.text: Clearly and without a doubt, it was Barbara that made our visit fantastic.  Personally I was a little concerned when there was no one at the door when I arrived to meet my dinner guest so I had to venture around, and that was the only hit. After that Barbara took over and made dinner a truly satisfying experience. Food was hot, brought out without a long wait, delicious, and best of all was our Server ... Barbara who has only been there 3 days!!!  She's a really good hire!!

ohz0cDS7-7-oMHKvQ1B7fw.text: Had been to the other Sammy's on 215/Flamingo and the one on Rainbow in Arroyo Crossing Shopping Center. Both were good experiences BUT this place was drastically different. Upon walking in, place looks unkept and unorganized. We were seated and basically just sat there for 15 minutes and no one came over nor even bothered to address us that they would be right with us. There was some clueless blonde lady walking around(who appeared to be the manager) but did not really seem to notice her staff were just meandering about aimlessly. We walked out and went to Elephant Bar down the street.

K-yvjIbKQf1KfViwSDFrUQ.text: Just had appetizers and the ahi poke, duck tacos and the chicken lettuce wrap were all fantastic!!  Great Hawaiian flavors, intentional or not, was spot on!!  Will be back!!  Ambiance was surprisingly bright, lots of windows, may try out their brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Windows at Sammy&#39;s!!

tOg1XsM3FUv1TCRv31Bxjg.text: Soooo happy to have found Sammy's here in Henderson. We loved going there when we lived in California but moved away from the areas of their locations. We went last night for New Years Eve, could not have been better! Happy to see the original (to us anyways) menu items. The chicken balsamic salad was as great as we remembered. The margarita pizza, splendid! We shared a Messy Sundae which lived up to its name. Great waiter, minimal wait time. Overall great evening. We will definitely be back to try out the newer menu items!!

aZqy4aJ_Ax7UhsKWW2lxiA.text: The duck taco appetizer is very good. I had the salmon and it was a little better than average but had a lot of sauce. The atmosphere is super cool with a ton of sunlight. They also open the windows when the weather is appropriate.

e2UZzH5N9xQz2SMv31woGQ.text: Have not had service this exceptional in a long time. Albert was my server and extremely attentive and helpful even when the place was slammed. The greeting from the front door to the goodbye when we left this place is the epitome of hospitality.

GY97tnGfGvjoJmVBc6MMdg.text: Went for a birthday dinner, Wednesday 1.20.2016. Had one elderly mom using a walker. Maybe had 20 tables in the immediate area to sit and the host starts walking us past the 20 tables all the way to the rear of the restaurant. Not sure why they would even think of having the guest struggle walking let alone that distance, when we were standing next to available tables. The waitress was prompt & courteous, took the order, received drinks, food was fantastic! Than she disappeared. The rest of the meal no service was to be had. Just plan awful. Could not even get our check without tracking her down. Once we had the check she never came back to pick up the payment. For that reason it will be along time before I go back to this establishment. They really need to step up the service to at least OK instead of horrible!

TV08Dc1etm0pw4dGKnuE7g.text: The reason why I give this place 5 stars is because our server was amazing. She was very sweet, nice, and understanding. Not only was she checking in on us frequently, she even gave the best suggestions for the food as well. We got the meatballs, tomato basil soup, and the New York pizza. Her name was Naz, I believe, very kinda and beautiful! I will go here again and again if you continue to have people just like her! Thank you again Naz!!

x0yoJVfnOdHH4TkZGT2Msw.text: I'm not sure how the full menu us here but the tapas/appetizer section is fantastic! We got the lentil, prosciutto, and arugula salad (not sure why it's called this because it's not a salad, deconstructed or not), the duck tacos, coconut shrimp, almonds and olives, and lobster Mac and cheese...  The duck tacos and lobster Mac were really really delicious, big hunks of real lobster and good flavor on Mac and the duck tacos were really nice and meaty and crispy. The olives and toasted marconas were really great quality too and I really liked the salad - you know, for not being a salad and all. The only misfires were the coconut shrimp and it wasn't a misfire so much as they were a little boring and a bit over cooked but we were pretty much tearing up the rest ;). The wine we ordered was turned but that happens. The weird part was the waitress seemed to anticipate a problem and almost be waiting to see if we could tell the difference. When we told her the wine was way off she acted like she figured it had gone bad, we kind of looked at each other in surprise at the table. I hate to speculate beyond that because I really loved the meal and casual atmosphere but if you get some less than yummy wine, do us all a favor and vanish it to a land far far awayyyy!!

xvv0-9iZtwVdXkrnDPvrdw.text: A new Sammy's Restaurant in Henderson, relocated, remodeled and revamped!  The biggest difference is the location, though. The old Sammy's was hidden away on Sunset Rd, very hard to find. This new spot on Green Valley Pkwy is much more convenient and visible!   Opening the menu, it looked familiar with the original items, plus a few new additions (or have I just overlooked them?)   Vietnamese Crab Stack was refreshing, light, and very tasty. Presented so elegantly, my whole table enjoyed it.   Off the happy hour menu, the Kobe Sliders had rave reviews from my boyfriend & his parents.  I've also enjoyed: Mediterranean Dip Sampler Hummus Oak Roasted Asparagus Lobster Mac & Cheese Wok'd Sesame Shishito Peppers Grilled Shrimp Salad Salted Caramel Pudding  The food overall is pretty darn good. From their huge salad portions, unique tapas, Brie/truffle oil pizza w/ mushrooms (my favorite Sammy's pizza), or the ginormous Messy Sundae's overflowing goblet, there's many great dishes for every palate and appetite. Plus I ALWAYS appreciate any establishment that offers and labels vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options!  For me the best thing about this Sammy's is the interior set-up. I LOVE their patio area, where you can sit in plushy comfortable couches(with pillows!) which are part of their booths and look out the surrounding windows. It makes it airy, spacious, and welcoming. I can see me eating lunch there frequently if I worked nearby.  The prices are still pretty high, I always thought that. If ordering tapas, it's a shame if you don't go during happy hour, when selected items are half off.   Service has been a hit or miss here. It seems the first visits, the staff were still getting used to their new operation, so their timeliness was off. It's gotten better though, our last dinner with our parents was awesome! We'll be come back to try their brunch...

88tjTIb8FuDPxDtf6VxTOA.text: Stopped in for brunch and the place was almost empty  When we arrived we asked for the no kids section and was placed at a booth with only  one other couple in the area  Next couple in the restaurant had a baby with them and was placed next to us even after they requested a different location   Thanks for the no kid area   Service was S L O W  Waited 10 plus min between empty Coffey cup and refill. Asked for a carafe and it held one cup of cuffed and was empty  Took close to an hour to get served after we ordered and the Couple  seated after us got their food before we got appetizers   Only saving grace was the food tasted good

bZMFjrv-kWdxVLtWqs9qBg.text: We used to love coming here! But the service has gone down hill... Food prices have good up!! For a family dinner it's taken 1 hour just to get the food. 40 minutes to order!! And the order isn't even correct. How about writing the order down?  Please Sammys hire more servers and/or train them better.

-wi1KDon02Z1YIhr2dUnFg.text: I've been here a few times and have tried a few items on the menu and it's always just okay. I've tried their pizzas, salads, desserts, variety of appetizers, and I've never had anything that really impressed me. The kobe beef sliders is usually what I go for when I come here because they are probably the best thing on the menu. The last time I went here they had a lot of new items and I was pretty excited about them. I tried the empanadas from the appetizers. Being Argentinian, I was interested in seeing what their interpretation of an empanada would be. Sadly, they were not very good. They were definitely not your traditional empanada. It seemed like they were frozen and heated up in a microwave. Needless to say, I won't be ordering them again. The service here is fantastic though, so I kind of wish their food matched the service.   A few tips:  If you want bread, you will have to ask for it. They don't provide it to you otherwise.  The salads here are huge, even for sharing. I would recommend getting the individual sized salad, even if you are sharing it. If you have the option, ask the hostess to seat you on the right side of the restaurant. This is where they have huge windows that brings in a lot of natural lighting.

kbpGYSRRJhxoy_0ypgKX6Q.text: I'm from out of town, this being my first experience with this restaurant i was impressed with the service behind the bar. First off Matty and crew did a fantastic job with their service. They were quick and attentive and Johnny on the spot with my questions. The drinks had a nice punch and mixed correctly so I could enjoy my meal and not be overly buzzed. The food well the Kobe sliders were nice, the pizza under whelming with first try cold. That was not my gripe, for the True downer to the attentive patron was the manger chewing out in slient fashion the bartenders for a issue with the togo's and taking out $10 from their tip jar. My business opinion, since I own three, is to have dedicated personal for Togo orders. The bar was super slammed with just restaurant business. The star of the show was the service at the bar and the sweet hostess whom picked up my fallen coat from my stool on more then one occasion. The empathy is there with the staff, and so I will be back tomorrow to try something new on the menu, for I recommend this place.

yOS0GwO6-0D5Qg61VyqAww.text: We dined for Brunch on Saturday, It WAS EXCELLENT! The dining room area was clean, well decorated and quiet so we could visit. 5k45dATpkffvIkxjwAiQsw.text: Live in Green Valley Ranch, and frequent Sammy's often. Was there tonight for a special occasion. because we have always had a wonderful time and great food.  Tonight - and as I can see from reviews on Yelp for the past five months that validates tonight's experience - service was an absolute disaster.  Appetizers took way too long to come out. When one if the managers came by to see how we were doing, I made a comment about the kitchen being backed up. He said she would find out what the delay was. Literally sixty seconds later, they came out... along with one entree. Sent that back and were told they would remake it and serve with the other entrees. Entrees came out - 4 of the 6 ordered. Ten minutes later the missing two finally came out after my husband complained to the manager.  Had to send one of the entrees back. These mishaps continued throughout the evening. Though the manager 'adjusted' our bill to compensate for all the mishaps, our semi-absentee waiter and all the other mistakes ruined the evening. And from recent reviews, these types of issues have been ongoing for months. No wonder, on a Saturday night, the place was half empty.  Please Sammy's - FIX THE PROBLEMS. We'll not be back until we see better reviews.

RW6R2_bfSWHF_V9-0QPQ8Q.text: Have eaten at other Sammy's locations many times over the years in Las Vegas and Henderson - but my visit to this location will serve as my last visit to Sammy's.  Service was just awful (tapas and first courses served after entrees were brought out - not sure if this was an issue with the kitchen or the waitstaff), food was unremarkable at best, management was not on top of anything and made no effort to address any issues, charges were on the bill for upcharges not disclosed on the menu, one item came to the table with an ingredient incorporated in the item that requested to not be in the item, that the server verified would be left out of the dish (guess they are not concerned about or attentive to guest requests for preferences, potential food allergies, other items).  Way too many lapses in service, poor quality of food and lack of management oversight.  Never again, just terrible...

9YGvmd2Fqqfb_VMrs8Pvdg.text: What a disappointing departure from all the other Sammy's restaurants in town.  The food was the same as the other restaurants, but the service was atrocious.  I arrived at the restaurant an hour and a half before closing, but the employees were already working on cleaning and closing up the place instead of paying attention to the customers.  There were ~ 8-10 tables of customers, but only 2 servers that I saw working.  I saw 5 servers sitting at tables busy folding dozens of napkins.  Others were refilling the condiments on the tables. Meanwhile, our server took 15 minutes to initially approach us.  Water took another 10 minutes and tasted like it came straight from the faucet, although our server assured us that it was triple filtered.  One bottle of beer came to our table almost 20 after we ordered it!  Out server brought our food out without any serving utensils (we had to ask for it) and one glass of wine didn't arrive until our meal was almost finished.  Instead of checking us, he was busy chatting with his coworkers. The most insulting part of our meal was the 2 employees who were furiously sweeping the floor around us as we ate.  I wondered how they would like it if I swept dirt up in the air around their food while they ate.  If I ever return to this location, it will be for take out.  It's a shame because the restaurant is very nice, much nicer than the other locations.

iFImeDTqVWwZqXXfV3LvsA.text: Ordered to go today and as usual, food was fantastic. I ordered a Chinese Chicken Salad and Wagyu Burger which both had great flavor and totally hit the spot. John greeted me on the phone and took my order. He and I spoke about different selections on the menu. I was surprised at not only how well he knew the menu, but how he was able to suggest items based on the menu items I was ordering. It was nice to talk to someone about the many different dishes. It would take forever to try them all! He was friendly, hospitable and very willing to take care his customers. So Thanks for your help today John! Keep up the great work, we will be back. Zb0zheap4lT7TSEox320GA.text: Love the decor and love going here for happy hour. Lots of great little plates to snack on over a glass of wine. The pizza is delicious as well. The service is either exceptionally great, or just okay. Depends on the server. Bonus is enjoying a beautiful day there when they have the sliding windows open.

V0-ByWiPOQfaP4SpZnnHjg.text: My family of four went last Friday night around 7 pm. We worried because this is  usually a very busy time, and they were very busy, but we only waited about 10 minutes outside, which was not bad at all. However, there is no place to wait inside, especially on a busy night and they need to hand out buzzers so the hostess doesn't have to come out and yell names aloud. Luckily it wasn't cold outside, so waiting was not bad at all. I'm sure they will eventually get the buzzers.   Our server was very personable and gave good service. Our tapas appetizer of three different hummus dips with some sort of warm yummy pita bread was so good. It was perfect if you're just ordering a salad as your entree, because that's what I did and I was totally stuffed.   My daughters loved their dinners too: BBQ chicken with potatoes and cheeseburgers sliders with fries. I did wish they had something green on the side with the kids meals like broccoli or spinach, but the quality of the food was very good.  I would say the quality of these kids meals compared to other restaurants is better for sure.   I had my favorite balsamic salad with chicken. I've always loved this salad, but Sammy's needs to not drench it so much in the balsamic dressing. It was very good, but overly coated in dressing.    Husband had fish tacos which he said were very good.   For desert, we had the most delicious mini donuts with raspberry and chocolate dipping sauce. They were so good, they reminded me of churros. It was just perfect amount of sweet for four people. We loved it!  The ambiance was nice because it's fancy, but not so fancy that we didn't feel weird bringing our kids on a Friday night. We saw several other families with kids in our section, so that was good. You can tell they try to sit families near each other and the on a date and just adults in a separate section. Which is good for everyone because then the people with kids don't feel bad if they get too noisy with the people that are there without kids.   Of course, bringing kids we had to make 3 trips to the restrooms, which were small, but also very nice. Clean and pretty stone all the way up to the ceiling.   We will definitely be going back!

HM2FGAVjS-pcv-dcWhmiuw.text: Time and time again, I find myself at Sammy's. A unique twist on an old classic, Sammy's is much more than the pizza joint it used to be. The ambience is very unique and the atmosphere is one that none can compare to. There are two sides of the restaurant. One side being the traditional restaurant scenery with booths and tables and the other sides have just the opposite. There are giant windows surrounding the outside of the restaurant giving it an open feeling. The booths and tables have different chairs and set ups than the usual setting. There are plants all around that give this place a one of a kind decor. The food is also nothing short of fantastic. I've been here several times. To my surprise, I find that I enjoy this place more and more every time I stop by. If you're ever looking for something new and different, I would most definitely recommend Sammy's.

6a0UdgV6z2XoNDNDFL0ImA.text: Never had anything I didn't love. Their pizzas are all delish. Marcus works at the bar and always takes care of us

-WgZIlgYPfFu4Is1I6TZvA.text: I enjoyed the food here. I went a couple of days ago with 2 friends and we shared the baba ganoush which was SO GOOD! I had the mahi tacos w/ French fries which were good. The ambience is nice and the service was pretty good. I would go back and definitely get the baba ganoush and Peartini again.

I took some of the Tomato Bisque soup home to my sweetheart and he loved it so much, that later that night we went for dinner. bMhzYA20qDiQZjnKKfUlQA.text: I hosted a birthday brunch for 16 people yesterday (Saturday), and the food, drink, staff, and management were all excellent.  They allowed me to build a menu myself and printed off a copy for each guest with pictures of entrees but no prices.  Manager Paras and Assistant manager Tia responded to my email questions promptly and helped my daughters set up centerpieces, providing them with a small table for a powerpoint presentation and a cupcake stand.  The food  arrived for all 16 of us at the same time and was still hot.  Everyone said his/her selection was excellent, from the grilled asparagus omelet to the eggs benedict to the lemon and fresh blueberry pancakes.  Our server Jess checked in on us frequently and refilled coffees and mimosas several times.  I was worried because the restaurant does not have a separate banquet room, but for most of the 3 hours we were there, only a few other tables were occupied.  They did not rush us at all.  Thank you all for making my celebration top notch.

th3O8XmBCTJRZsjX6uZJSw.text: Great light pizza for those who want to eat healthy Sammy's the place to go. Even their pizza are very healthy and reasonably priced looking forward to the duck tacos.   The service was excellent, the only problem was they had no one working the front we had to look around we were even thinking of sitting ourselves or leaving Until finally some came. We went early evening; enjoyed a Woodfired pizza and the duck tacos... What a treat!  Not only was our meal great, but it was a True pleasure meeting the GM, Christine- thank you for a wonderful time!

_brBOv46uSZKYZBAURsgMg.text: Ordered takeout. Woefully sad amount of Pepperoni on the Pepperoni Pizzas. I counted 12 1-inch pieces of pepperoni for the entire pizza. Glad they have vegan cheese because of my dairy allergy, but omg it's not a pepperoni pizza with 12 tiny pieces of pepperoni! It's not an expensive product. My friend that got a "regular" cheese pizza also had about 12 pieces, so it's not a vegan cheese trade-off scenario. It's too bad because I liked ordering from a place that understands dietary/allergic restrictions. Boo!

c8pae1j2rDl2YRx3Hg11RA.text: Service is REALLY bad today.  Our server Ramon came by and took our drinks and then did not come back for well over 5 minutes to take our order.  He cleared plates from tables, stopped to check to soccer stats on the tv, stopped to talk to another employee before going to drop off the dirty dishes.  He finally came back and took our orders.  I told him I wanted to start with the chili and either the kitchen was really slow or our server took forever to pick it up and bring it to us.    Throughout the meal he would disappear for a really long time.  Another table of two came in and were so annoyed they let him know how unhappy they were.  Needless to say their food came very quickly, but then he would disappear.  He brought us our bill when we were finally done, he dropped it off and disappeared for a good 8 to 10 minutes, really???  When we left, he was standing at the bar watching the soccer game even though he still had more tables to serve and did not even notice us walking past him, another employee also watching the tv noticed us and said goodbye as we reached the door.  Overall it was an interesting night, normally the manager comes around to see how things are going, not tonight....the only person I saw who looked like a manager hung out at the bar while the music was playing and when Ryan was done as he was cleaning up she hung out by him chatting with him.  I guess customers were not the priority on this night....

hDaMsic3LLBwhMYUR1OSnQ.text: Rachel and Garrett are seriously the best bartenders in Henderson. They know your drinks the minute you sit down and they take wonderful care of you. Love this place.

NGnEUiXicoBaEfhJfHxLmA.text: We really enjoyed our visit here. The floor to ceiling sliding doors coupled with the beautiful weather was so relaxing. My husband and I shared the shrimp salad, hummus and Brie pizza and they were all delicious. Our kids loved the wood fired pizza. The server was attentive and very helpful. Also, they give a great military discount, which we really appreciate. Great little neighborhood restaurant and we look forward to returning.

BFHgI9sKvho5sZAQ-Mv-ig.text: We always enjoy.. great service, nice ambiance and yummy food.  I love their hummus!!

KKmIj2q7HY-3NYxZ8FgrJA.text: Alexxx is awesome! Literally the only reason I come here after work with my co workers! Always a good time with him behind the bar!

n9CiQHOJXe-nhP4OE25ABg.text: I really like this place. The food is far above the average local restaurant and bar, it's fantastic. It's very clean here and the environment is lively, full of light (there are beautiful windows) and class. If you are looking for somewhere to take a date, or take your family for a birthday (including kids) this is a classy yet down-to-earth diner. You need to check them out and oh yeah - the waitress Taylor is GREAT! :) She was attentive yet did not interrupt our conversation she made her presence known but let our conversation continue with out the usual server interruption "how is everything" .....I hate that..... I really appreciated Taylor and her professionalism. She was the cherry on top of a great meal and great conversation between me and my friend. Thanks Sammy's! We will be back :) esp for those tiny burgers OMG they are so good!! This is from their website and I could not agree more: "A stylish setting and innovative menu come together at our newest Sammy's restaurant at the corner of Green Valley Pkwy & Pebble Rd. Also featuring 24-hour gaming and events all month long!" -- ps go during happy hour 4-6 PM everyday and appetizers are a full serving and 1/2 price :) what a deal ..

Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States. Mini Kobe Beef Burgers OMG get these! LOL perfect for sharing :)

YnSnboJoc0C4DKYPzLRS2Q.text: This location is so much better than the GVP/Sunset restaurant, in my opinion.  From the service to the ambiance to the food.  Tonight we shared the chopped chicken salad.  Roasted Tomatoes AND kalamata olives please!  This is a consistent winner.  Plump, warm pieces of chicken with a little char, tangy dressing, tomatoes, tart olives, basil and mozzarella.  What's not to love?  I also ordered the Oak Roasted Chicken dinner.  Had to take most of it to go (it comes with 2 chicken breasts), but the pesto and pine nut concoction was great.

sAjhQ_u0dbj1qbUT_fes5A.text: Slow service at lunch however the pizza and the salads were worth the wait. I believe they're a little understaffed but worth the trip there

1dHbqEwJbK7L75_5EbJVtw.text: Sammy's is still stylin!  I've been back many times over the past few years and still enjoy it.  The location being right off of Green Valley and Pebble is easy to find.  The dining ambiance here is always great.  It's clean and has a welcoming feeling.  Service here can be hit and miss. For the most part they have been pretty friendly and attentive.    I finally ordered one of their huge salads.  It was an absolute delight! The Balsamic Grilled Chicken is one that I'd order again. It's filled with mixed greens, Gorgonzola, walnuts, basil and tossed in balsamic vinaigrette.  Definitely filling!  The appetizers have been a let down. Im probably going to start skipping those to go right into the main meal.  Burgers, wraps and salmon have all been good.    I'm happy that for the most part things have stayed on par since opening.

NK00rUWMcq68Dls7Lz8F-w.text: We came for Easter Brunch the food didn't come out at the same time although it was good. Our server Dawn was not very friendly and abandoned us after she dropped off the check. We wanted dessert but couldn't get anyone else to wait on us.

NMhq3-V1BZqRC7Z9NIjxfA.text: My wife and I frequently dine at Sammy's Woodfired Pizza and Grill on Green Valley Parkway in Henderson, NV.  We have found the menu to be varied, appealing, and tasty.  The entire staff, from managers to servers, have great people skills.  They are very friendly, efficient, and make us feel welcome.  Last night, March 2, are server was Jess.   Although they were extremely busy, Jess was very accommodating and timely with our meals.  In the past, we have also had exemplary service from Dawn and Rachel.

I could honestly say I've probably had all of their pizzas... And not once have I been disappointed ( my favorite being the thin crust margarita pie )  so go! Enjoy yourselves!

-jnb_pUZwIsNG29sfRRybg.text: Highly recommend. The restaurant is very clean, beautiful ambience, friendly staff, lower weight times no matter what time you go. Beautiful view, amazing food no matter what you order. I recommend trying the duck tacos, the chopped Asian chicken salad, the cheese breadsticks, the tropical tea and order the steak that you cook on the rock. The kids will love that. All-around great place and reasonably priced. Plenty of parking.

4Xw4_X2xFYGEzXHc5SflBQ.text: The food is sooo yummy with lots of great choices! Raychelle was our server and she was amazing!! Sooo friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is chill and comfortable. This is definitely a place to enjoy with your friends, family or just by yourself  we will for sure be back!

Z-99m2REBbNtovYWU5fwyA.text: Such a shame.  This place has good food...once they're able to get it out of the kitchen.  Waited 40 minutes for a salad.  I'd excuse them if it were busy.  But with an open kitchen, you can see for yourself the cooks standing around with folded arms.  Are they on strike?? Our poor flustered waitress was having to greet and seat guests, serve food and bartend.  Meanwhile, the manager  disappears for long periods of time, prompting the lounge bartender to loudly ask, "where is he???!" Time for this place to have a deep and meaning staff talk.

A1N9Fyw5cqQWQJMk1kCvyQ.text: Sammy's wood fire Pizza is one of my Favorite restaurants for Salads. They make the best Chicken chopped Salad. It's out of this world. With that said all there food is really Good. I can't say enough about the place. For the ones that have never tried it please do you will be going back as a regular.  Brian

S-WoSBSLUbu17zS_fsTjQg.text: Great food, Great service! Some must tries: Hot Rock. So cool, you get to cook NY Strip how you like it on a hot rock. Lobster Bisque.  Spicy Italian Sausage Pizza. My Favorite! Chinese Chicken Salad. Spicy Chicken Angel Hair Pasta. Never disappoints. Wagyu Cheeseburger. Everything is great and the staff will make sure you have a great time!

CresfeUdp0IpCBo20my0OA.text: I love the selection, great salads and very earthy feel. Perfect for casual night out or working lunch or dinner with their outlets for use in a few booths.   Very open neighborly feel.

Us_pflwGPKBPvL-kINWrSg.text: Great food and super service!  We had a large group and our server, Dawn was amazing!  Definitely one of my favorite places to eat.

KED1BxEu36H-uhfQS07kEw.text: Must go to Sammy's for the dessert!  They have a great happy hour and beautiful atrium seating.  The pizza is good and has many other options on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sammy's Restaurant & Bar - Henderson, NV, United States

gvjIAsu3AaDmRVaOHWQCcg.text: Nice people, good food, convenient to work and home. I dine here frequently, and have had no complaints so far. I almost had a complaint earlier because of some child screaming. I understand it's hard to raise infants/toddlers, but it's also common decency to try to comfort the kid without being a nuance to other patrons. Not this parent. This mom decided to ignore the screaming and totally disregard the other people trying to dine at the establishment. I was about to make a complaint, but apparently somebody beat me to it. The parent was asked to take the screaming kid outside, and the parent threw a fit. Immediately I saw where the child gets their mannerisms from, as the mom proceeded to cuss out and berate the employee that kindly asked them to step out. Mind you, the employee didn't tell her to leave and never come back, she kindly asked her to take her son outside momentarily to calm him down. Nothing rude about the employee, extremely rude of the mom. I'll continue to come here, as they genuinely care for the convenience of all patrons.  Update: So, I gotta say, what is going on with the music on Sundays? It's like elevator music for hipsters. I just got done listening to an electronica version of Bob Marley's "Is This Love," and I'm pretty sure Bob is rolling in his grave due to that rendition (and listening to it, made me want to join him).   Now the song that's playing: it's like a song that makes me want to play in traffic or dance the salsa. Either scenario is probable at this point, but I'm leaning towards the first option.  Here's a recommendation, since it's a pandora station from what I believe: Put it on Gary Clark Jr.'s station, and call it good. Some awesome blues would be fitting for the atmosphere.   You're welcome. Keeping the rating at a 5, even though the music on Sundays is upsetting.

kWl-9rk0KSCA-2XnqxciuQ.text: Pizza was so tasteless and bland. Worst pizza I've ever had. BBQ chicken not spicy like usual. I won't go back there's too many good pizza places.

OeOBT1Me45hYHnaxtFhILg.text: I will give 2 stars because of the desert was good! Service was horrible, salad looked old and didn't taste fresh, pizza was okay! I am not planning on coming back.

AdqH3-mVXs5ziF827wzDEA.text: This place is amazing!  Great food, and the staff is incredible!!!  Mandy is hands down the best bartender ever!!  Highly recommend to all!!!

XoFX66kZhB5RKz4VfZRzxQ.text: We used to love Sammy's but as of tonight we will no longer be dining there. I was asked to leave because my 3 year old was crying, no louder then music and ambient noise. We saw exactly who complained and it was not multiple people. I was not in anyway ignoring my child nor did I have any disregard for the other patrons.  I do need to recant my review above.... Paras the regional manager and the GM have since made contact and we have resolved what had happen. To everyone reading this, everyone has different parenting styles and from the outside you do not know their situation. Please do not judge a book by its cover.

btkSNhTgqZpf5v-8dtcKAQ.text: Great place to have food and drinks, staff is friendly and service is fast. We've been there several times and will continue to go back. Try it out Vegas

oQHb-IHN3sU43a8B_SN1Tw.text: Bullshit!!!! This is the last that I ordered a delivery. I waited more than hour and half. I received a cold pizza. If you want to receive a cold pizza to your home this is the perfect place. The manager was an asshole on the phone

GeYKPHeifHxVXCY7CjJqug.text: Great food! Great service! The managers and wait staff are friendly and professional. Mandy in the gaming lounge is wonderful! She is attentive and is always smiling. Keep up the good work Sammys!

srCz-uJDqSaxcCuR5lQ_-g.text: The worst take out I've ever had. The $10.00 Caesar salads were little dinner salads with super oily Caesar dressing. Kids couldn't eat it, they'll eat anything. I didn't get to eat dinner because I gave my spaghetti and meatballs to my kids. You could tell the person who put it together doesn't care at all. Oh and the chicken for the salads was over cooked so bad it was blackened to much to eat. Just crazy and I like Sammy's. I've been to green valley location many times and always enjoyed it. Take out from green valley was such that I'll never order take out again.

1fKT5w-Dl7fRanwtzGp6yg.text: Stopped by here with the wife on Sunday evening.  Had the duck mini-tacos, sausage pizza and five cheese pizza with chicken and the flourless chocolate cake for desert.  The only thing holding this back from a 5 star rating was that the server did not pay us much attention, he was busy setting places on other tables and carrying stuff from one station to another.  Make no mistake though, everything coming out of that kitchen is delicious!

ccfHLhuEflbsVZ76rtr6VA.text: Love love love this place, it's awesome.  The bartenders are Great and super friendly.  I'm working my way through the specialities and have yet to be disappointed!  I'm thankful to have found this cozy hideout just a week after I moved here from CA.

ZwtoeS19Zlk6E1hcnC60cg.text: One of my fav spots in Henderson/GVR for the atmosphere and the food is fairly tasty. Great place to grab a drink and chill with friends. cool seating for dining and at the bar. Definitely upscale and different from most Sammys.

mAze0P6p2MFr9CxKInqMdA.text: I would have given this place a 3.5 star because I usually enjoy the food.  The service isn't usually that great but no big deal, the lobster bisque and garlic cheese bread (my favorite) out-weighs the not so attentive service.  Last night will be the last time I eat from this place.  I ordered the lobster bisque and garlic cheese bread to go and brought it right home and ate it.  About 2 hours later I began throwing up violently on and off for a couple hours.  Waking up this morning on Thanksgiving of all days still with a very upset and sensitive stomach.  I have no other "illness type" symptoms.  I think the need to have someone from the health department come out and check the dates and temps because I definitely got sick from eating from here last night.  Not good at all.

xo_SJUolcWnbDOcnU9SRSA.text: I had a great experience here, Marcus was our bartender. So friendly and nice to talk to. My shrimp salad was awesome large and delicious I ate every piece of it. I was recommended here by one of my guest at Kings fish house and I'm very happy I came. I heard they have a great happy hour. Bar stools where very comfy. :-) Mike next door was very friendly too.

OGkWD2YJletJDVdblZDz0A.text: I absolutely love this place...the bartenders rock and the food is superb! I would recommend this place to anyone in the GV area.

sBhy6rZh2Wo6qvT6zDxb6Q.text: What a beautiful place.  The decor is lovely.  The very large sliding glass doors were open so we could enjoy listening to the birds and feel the warmth of the sun.  Food was delicious and the service excellent.  Definitely a return trip in our future.

0xwpjZeeDAhm791tjK8Enw.text: Excellent service, waiter was great. Nice new clean vibe from place, gaming area in back is recommended. Had wagyu burger and fries with lobster mac and cheese. eJCKyg0j-s_X6ALBVBsrKg.text: We love this place, it's one of our favorites. The food is always good, the servers and bartenders are all so friendly and happy. The Brussel sprouts are amazing!! I add salmon to any salad, truffle fries, yum!! Ahi tuna wontons, awesome.... Hummus is great!! They have an amazing happy hour which allows you to sample so many things for great prices!!!!

EQkSec-c_cBcUig2nvshoA.text: I came here on a Friday night with my family. I called ahead and they said it would be about 35min. We got there early and got seated on time. However, they need a better way or space for people waiting for a table.   The ambience was very nice (Californian). Cozy.  The menu was very diverse with still the staple of Sammy's (pizzas). Boys got pizza and burger, thumbs up. Asian salad was okay. Shrimp and grits good, but have to grab some chorizo and grits for flavor. Salmon with edamame was horrible. Their idea of flavor is to layer soy sauce on the bottom of the plate. No! Deducted Star.  Service was okay. Waitress didn't seem to have a good day maybe?   Overall, service just seemed off from the time you come in the restaurant to the end of service. Deducted star.  I would go back to give it another try.

n7te2oImMjwnesU0lCm8FQ.text: Delicious food, beautiful atmosphere and very friendly staff. I will definitely be back. Also they have a great lunch special, 2 for $10. Two thumbs up!

iBH09RxQxepVWdzG0Fr_qw.text: We've lived in this neighborhood for two years and never even tried Sammy's.  It just looked like a local, quick gambling joint.  We were wrong.  We've now been there twice, and both times it was very good.  The first time we had the satay and calamari appetizers.  The chicken satay was cooked beautifully and was tender, but the best part of it was the peanut sauce.  We liked it so much we ordered a container of it to bring home.  The calamari was different than we've ever had.  It was more of a calamari meatball than regular fried calamari.  It was seasoned well and cooked well.  I really liked it, but my wife did not like the texture.  The second time we had the Asian appetizer which included potstickers, satay, and grilled shrimp, and they were all superb.  We also had the Thai salad and the NY pizza.  The chicken on the salad was tender and very good.  The pizza had great taste and was cooked evenly on the bottom, which is better than 99% of the other wood fired pizza places.  We also had one of the best servers we ever had.  Her name was Jess.  She was cheerful, prompt, and had great follow-up even though the restaurant was full and she was very busy.  She saw we hadn't received our food yet and checked on it without our asking.  We appreciated that she didn't give us a personal sob story to increase our tip.  We will certainly go back to Sammy's again.

bfVfa9c1a0M4I8ExqZxQKw.text: Awesome food. Great environment with live music. We got the pizza and garlic knots. Waiters were friendly and welcoming.

SzuBIDFZpEx8QleNLpCkAA.text: Guaranteed great service. Staff is always fun and personable. The Greek salad is to die for! The messy sundae will put you in sugar coma. The atmosphere alone is open and cozy with great natural lighting.

Z3t1q1GHkjyl8A9a4sbUjQ.text: I have been eating at this place for years with my friends and family locally and from out of town.. this is my GO TOO place! Never had a bad experience. Their food just gets better and better every time I'm there, which I didn't know was possible.. LOVE this place, must try if you've never before! :)

q7T1y1C0Nf30q2C71DHTNA.text: Waited a few minutes to be seated, and that pattern continued throughout the meal.  Waited for drink order, waited for food order and waited  for drink refills( my personal hot button issue). The pizza was good, but had to enjoy it without a drink.  Food was good, but poor service distracted from the experience.

4Y6_Brt92578AcwsjvfnvA.text: I have been here a few times and I love the food, however the service is horrible! We waited 10 min for our drinks after being ordered...dirty dishes sat on our table for too long and we had to remind our server of drinks we had ordered so we could get them in before happy hour was over. I felt like the whole serving staff was weak, which normally reflects bad management...

jJdI_lKr0EUo6kVaeS_C5g.text: We had always heard that Sammy's food was so good and couldn't wait to try it.  So on Friday night, we placed an order to go.  We ordered a 5 cheese pizza and were completely disappointed.  I should have known that it wasn't going to be good as when I picked up the box, I had to check to see that there was a pizza in there as it was so light.  The pizza tasted like something you'd get at Cici's or a low chain buffet.  Completely disappointed.  We also ordered the Balsamic Grilled Chicken Salad and this was ok.  The chicken was a bit burnt and dry.  We also ordered some Pork Dumplings and they were probably the best thing we ordered.  As for the service, there was some confusion on how to pay for a to-go order when I went to pick it up . . . they were nice enough about it, but just seemed like they still haven't gotten the flow of a new restaurant yet.  I looked at the other reviews and just didn't have the same experience as others had.  Maybe it was an off night . . . maybe the food doesn't hold up when you take it to go.  Maybe we need to dine in and see what we think before completely writing off this restaurant.   I do know this . . . . If I want to order Pizza to go, I would much rather get it from Metro Pizza.  Hands down!!!

Cfkq3pmtMpZUonsajTUYaA.text: What a disappointment. Have been here multiple times and really expected much more. Had family in town and really bragged up this place. We called ahead and requested a reservation for 6 at 6pm. Table was ready as promised. Seating was not good. They had us in a large round table half sofa seating. My guests had to use pillows to try and elevate them to the table. Very uncomfortable.  My son ordered the lobster mac and cheese. It came out in a small bowl, nothing at all special. He swore up and down that it was either artificial lobster or maybe even imitation crab  meat. Very small portion, meat was not very good. Mom ordered duck tacos. Has had them many times before. Evidently the chefs are being pressured to watch food costs. There was nothing more than a tiny sliver of duck meat on each tack. Very chincey. The service was lousy. We had to ask multiple times for dishes to be removed from the table, drinks to be refilled.  We are not alcohol drinkers. OUr total bill with tip was $170 for 6 of us. Not one person was blown away by their meal. All of us were disappointed in the quality of food. Very disappointing.

gZD38DQCXR4YOdwStII8cw.text: Absolutely love this place!  I have been back (since the Yelp event) 4 times!!  The food is so delicious as are the drinks.  I love the non-alcoholic pomegranate drink!!  The gluten free pizza is so much better than most gluten free pizzas and I love how many gluten free options they have!  This place is amazing!!

BeSVanEGIZzCm62wFbZDYw.text: Arrived at 8:50 pm, we were promptly greeted at and sat by a young man wearing glasses. There were about 8 people at the bar, the bartender said hello as we walked to our table. There were 4 tables dining.  We were told Heather would be right with us. After perusing the dinner choices on the menu Heather arrived. She asked if we would like anything to drink. I had flipped my menu over and as I was deciding between the house chardonnay and the Clos du bois Heather apparently grew impatient. She said I'll get you some waters in a clipped tone. Not more than 45 seconds had transpired since she had arrived at the table. We said water would be great thank you. She arrived back with the waters and said she would come back if we hadn't decided on entrees. We then ordered the crab and artichoke dip. She did not ask if we wanted anything other than water. I felt as though she was judging us, our appearances, and our financial status.  When she came back from placing the appetizer order I ordered a wine and we placed our dinner order. The appetizer was tasty and we enjoyed it while mulling over what Heather's issue might be. While waiting for our entrees we heard a plate clatter to the floor in the direction of the kitchen. We joked that it was one of our dinners considering the amount of time that had passed. 5 or more minutes later Heather comes to tell us it would just be a few more minutes. Ten minutes later she tells us my sliders were burnt on the outside so the kitchen was remaking them.  I work in Hospitality as a Supervisor for a large corporation and have heard every excuse for a long ticket time there is. Blaming the kitchen is a servers go-to excuse. Once the food arrived we were for the most part satisfied with it, but still slightly put off by Heather's demeanor. She was not friendly, nor did she attempt to engage in any manner. We were one of her two tables she was serving at the time. We ate quickly and when she came to clear the plates she asked if we wanted dessert. At this point I had decided against dessert not because I didn't want have dessert but because I didn't wish to be Heather's guest any longer. She brought the check, I placed my card in the book and she offered mini doughnuts to go on the house. Too little too late. I'm not saying we will not dine again because the food was enjoyable once it arrived, I am simply hopeful that should we dine again we get a server that enjoys their job and puts customer service first. We left Heather a 16% tip which was generous considering her service.

jJ9IUzSNn_cynayfsWDgIw.text: I ate here last night for the first time and loved it! I got a grilled chicken and hummus wrap and it was so delicious.  A perfect blend of flavors!  The service was ok but far from good. The prices were very reasonable.  I will definitely go back for the food!

DyI8BWLp3KAIOiRve9tP-Q.text: I went here for dinner tonight. The food was very good. But the staff did not seem knowledgeable. I'm in the restaurant industry. I have always worked where you need to know the menu. I ordered a glass of reisling and the server asked if it was red or white! I asked about the Greek yogurt on the menu she didn't know it was there. Upon leaving I asked the manager about it and he didn't know about it either. It still says 24 hours on website and menu but it's not! I will be back for the food. I just won't ask any questions. Get it together!

XNCHxFygPFKoyNlsOh-c6A.text: The service was horrible.  Ordered two pizzas and a salad. 35 minutes for the pizzas to arrive, they were room temperature.  The salad took another 25 minutes. Server was non-existent.  Had to ask other servers for drinks and our check.  Disappointing. Will not be back.

hzKLF-l7fwQfYEzqRSUOaA.text: AMAZING FOOD!!! I've been going here since before they relocated. The reason I only have 4 stars is because the service is just mediocre. But the atmosphere is awesome. I recommend  the walnut chicken salad. Hands down best thing on the menu!

BINAHQwnTNvgNfuDVAmTIw.text: I'm hooked.  Occasionally the service is less than stellar, and people tend to bring young, loud kids here later than the usual "young, loud kids" hours for family restaurants.  But the food is both sensational and out-of-the-ordinary.  I've been four times, and each time I order two items off the appetizer menu, which is both extensive and diverse.  "The Hot Rock" (spoiler alert!) was a huge surprise, as it's actually a stone heated to an extreme temp and served with raw beef strips that you cut up and heat on the rock itself.  It was an amusing novelty, and it turned out to be really enjoyable, too!  Also enjoyed the crab-and-artichoke dip (even the pita bread is fantastic) and an amazing hot fudge and caramel sundae we got for free because we celebrating a birthday.  Can't rave about the Kobe chili or the chinese chicken salad, but I think it was just a matter of personal taste.  I'd certainly recommend going after 8 on a weeknight or even later on the weekend, but overall Sammy's serves some wonderful dishes and definitely offers something DIFFERENT from the usual fare.

oX2sJdJHZVYqcobBJ1ECzA.text: I am so excited to have this fabulous restaurant so close to my home. The food here is so good, and I plan on eating here a lot! I love love the salads, especially the shrimp salad, I could eat it daily! The pizzas are wonderful, the crab stack appetizer, chicken lettuce cups, literally everything is delicious. This is destined to be one of my favorite places!

4Uxk-811be6hPTPaVj3M6Q.text: We had heard great things about Sammy's so we thought we would give it a go. We were greeted and sat promptly. Very crowded and had families around which made it a little loud for intimate conversation. I ordered a Lobster mac and cheese for a tapas appetizer, was not as impressed as the reviews posted said I would be. I did see a lot of them ordered. If it was half of the price it was offered at I would have been okay with it. taste wise it was good, had lumps of crab meet and a good amount of cheese. I ordered a pizza The New York Style. I thought New York style would at least be cooked through. The crust was crunchy but the middle was under cooked and doughy. not impressed. Not sure what specialty is here since their menu is all over the place. Josie had the Grilled Hawaiian Mahi Tacos. These were fresh and spicy, maybe too spicy for the spouse. I had some and I thought her choice for dinner out did mine. Overall it was nice, they were attentive which is a must. May or may not go here again. Can say to try it your experience may out way mine.

cMp2SPfLvdTAFoU7e5g8wA.text: Called ahead just in case and the awesome hostess saved my wife and I a table near the patio area! So customer friendly! Our server, Jewells, was so attentive and helpful with the menu. Tried the duck tacos which were perfect, had a nice dirty martini, and the toffee pudding was excellent. We loved the decor and atmosphere- This is truly one of our favorite places in Green Valley! Thanks so much to Sammys for a great night out for me and the wife!

Oq03jsQrzvHW7rf9swjdIQ.text: Sammy's has potential but the quality and consistency of both food and service need improvement for it to realize its potential.  One thing I did like is it clearly is a place that welcomes those of alternative lifestyles - very open minded.  Hopefully they can address their growing pains and put things in proper order.  Let the good times roll!!!

P7nL0AIX1SnebdLFTWIrmg.text: This place is the worst if you want fast service. We been there 3 times and 3 times the service was super slow the first time we had to ask for a awaited and end up the manager took our order and took forever to get ketchup and mustard for our burgers.second time we had to wait again for a waiter to come around. Third time we wait about 5-7mins to be seated and left so if u want extra slow service go here we won't be back!

gYh8zIND9QBj20EBXPWsFg.text: Great local gaming bar. Friendly bartenders. I would recommend better signage on the back entrance to the gaming bar and two more TVs behind the bar. Otherwise a gray place to watch a game.

4VFzgr9R3IdbgxBz9wdE-Q.text: Just had a long lunch at Sammy's with friends for a total of seven people.  The waitress was very attentive and was very thoughtful to suggest running separate checks to make it easier on the diners.  She was around frequently to refill drinks without ever having to be asked.  We ordered different wood fire pizza's and various salads.  I shared a thin pizza with sun dried tomatoes, pine nuts and goat cheese and it was so flavorful, fresh and light , I then shared a chopped salad with chicken with a very light red wine vinaigrette.  It was so fresh and delicious.  The serving sizes are very generous and the prices extremely reasonable.  New to the Henderson area,  this was the best restaurant I've been to.  I'm sorry I didn't remember the server's name but we were the only large table at 1 PM so many thanks for a great lunch.  For many of us at the table, this was our first time and we will definitely be back.

aZ_7ZNvMHzPUBqMKsD7a9g.text: So we decided to give Sammy's another shot after being invited back by the GM. SO glad we did!! The service was much improved this time around, we saw much more of our server, Alex, than we did of our server during our last visit. We had the dumplings (finally!) as well as their calamari, both of which were awesome. We also enjoyed their flourless chocolate cake. Some of the menu descriptions don't do this delicious food justice. We were thoroughly impressed not only by the display of exceptional management but also the fantastic server we had who not only made suggestions but also ensured our glasses were never empty and our plates didn't sit for too long. I hope this was not a fluke and I truly hope that Sammy's is striving to improve their customer service. As for us, we will certainly be back and recommend to friends in the GV area. I hope next time around the service and food are just as consistent. Thank you Sammy's staff for restoring my faith in the customer service industry!!

dg8c8xutg-pzNiHhihvG5w.text: I was visiting my gal in Henderson and she raved about this place. We went on 11/17/15 and sat at tables to the right (as you walk in the door) of the bar. The food was terrific and I would not hesitate to go there again for that reason.  The reason for the low star is our waitress. She was curt to the point of being rude.  My gal asked for the Orange-Horseradish sauce as an addition to her salmon, and the waitress say it's not horseradish sauce, it's Orange Marmalade. My gal asked her (very sweetly I might add) to check for her as it's delicious and she's had it before with the coconut shrimp.  The waitress brought her Orange Marmalade with no horseradish mixed in.  We went ahead and ate, then my gal asked for the menu and she, sweetly again, showed the waitress what she was talking about and the waitress said "Well, we call it Orange Marmalade" and walked off.  I wish I had my receipt for the gals name, but alas I don't.  When I come back we'll go there again, but I will refuse service from this rude brunette.

vOTcS1miCzmys9o7h37cFg.text: My family and I went there for my birthday. I have very high expectations seeing it's my birthday dinner. I choose to give them my money which will never happen again. It took 20 minutes for someone to take our order, I never knew my servers name, when the order was taken 2 entrees were not entered into the system.  Dressing was not brought and forgotten about. The chopped salad was the worst salad ever. No server came and asked if everything is ok. So here's my advice.... Do not give a server a busy station, servers need to communicate with customers as people because last time I check I was a person and I can be talked to about anything. The manager was absolutely amazing and I thank him for that but no service recovery helped us. Please retrain your servers. The customers deserve that for giving you their money and are there for a positive experience so they will be repeat customers. I hope this changes because it's just another checked off place that I will never go to.

MiwcN1eSB5cuLNOIT0--FQ.text: I really like Sammy's and have been a loyal customer at all the locations around Vegas through the years but that being said the last 2 visits have been not so good. The service has really gotten bad and the food is not as good as it used to be. It took over 15 minutes before a waiter came to my table. He was swamped and was trying to wait on too many tables. I noticed they didn't have any busboys or extra staff to clean the tables. The tables around me still had dirty plates and glasses from previous diners who had left. I understand the waiters were to take orders, run the food and clean up. It's never a good idea to cut back on staff when the patrons are the ones who suffer. It's not a great way to promote your restaurant. My family of 4 had wanted a quick lunch which turned into very long experience. After waiting 15 minutes to be spoken to add another 15 till we got our drinks and then 30 minutes till we got our food, which by the way was not what we ordered. My husband's order was not correct and it took another 15 minutes till they brought out his correct order. The prices have increased every time I have returned and I'm not sure its worth the price anymore.
